commit_message:
Add missing mock to test_set_external_network_empty

A missing mock causes test failures when using requests 2.4.0 (I'm
uncertain as to why). Add the mock, and change the "expected error
messages" assertion down to 1 since only one failure should occur (I
assume previously the failure on get_tenant_list caused a 2nd error
message to pop up).

Change-Id: Icb0110c5937c3d4e437cc708ce8dbb8d0edaae74
Closes-Bug: #1363159

commit_message:
Handle SolidFireAccountNotFound Exception

When committing 7a72303aff86ba2b06c41e73b35989cddd884652 in
order to address lpb:1357261, we introduced a problem that
will cause unhandled stack traces in c-vol logs.

We should have gone ahead and caught the exception and returned
appropriately so tha the calling modules would know what to do
(or not to do).

Change-Id: I83eac3b8ae5719bc14166268c55e6c185a6c49f6

commit_message:
Upstart changes require a way to restart keystone

It seems with 14.04 the upstart provider needs to be called directly
to work. the /etc/init.d/keystone doesnt exist anymore.

Change-Id: I0298a9281a92a9f6765a575e82cef1cdfc4d066b

commit_message:
Attribute variables for internal identity endpoint

This patch adds the identity-internal-endpoints attributes to complment
the first patch of this bug.  As cookbook-openstack-identity now
refences the  identity-internal endpoint these variables are now
required to be defined.  As per convention endpoints are defined in this
cookbook.

Following this patch the number of node.set used in the registration
tests can be reduced, as they will now have defaults defined here.
Additionally a bump of the identity cookbook to rely on common 10.0.3
will be required.
Once this is done this bug can be closed.

Change-Id: Iefca0b3df5b8efae94a661fc471c55a05cd8f64e
Partial-Bug: #1356732

commit_message:
Make DvrServerRpcCallback a separate callback class

RPC has a version of itself. In Neutron a plugin implements
several RPC interface, so a single RPC version doesn't work.
In Mixin callback class approach, RPC versioning depends on
each plugin implementation and it makes harder to maintain
RPC version appropriately. This patch series replaces mixin
RPC callback of server side with a separate class.

This commit handles server-side callback of DVR ML2 RPC interface.

Partial-Bug: #1359416
Change-Id: I1b6383f7b0af5d9aed18eda3a15f21d3504d0347

commit_message:
Remove instance relationship from InstanceExtra model

This patch removes the instance relationship defined in the
InstanceExtra model.  There's no case where we'll have this and need
to get back to the instance.  In all cases, we have an instance and
then go to additionally fetch this later.  This was pointed out by Jay
in the review where this table was added.

Change-Id: I35a89d22afea384e6b5a850d04dde527310f439f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/117774/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: instance = orm.relationship(Instance, backref=orm.backref('numa_topology', uselist=False), foreign_keys=instance_uuid, primaryjoin=instance_uuid == Instance.uuid)

commit_message:
Mock Glance Metadefinition API

This provides a mock API to Glance's soon to be released Metadata
Definitions Service.

Intended for use with the following horizon reviews:
 - https://review.openstack.org/104956 (Images widget + common code)
 - https://review.openstack.org/112874 (Flavors widget)
 - https://review.openstack.org/110612 (Host aggregate widget)
 - https://review.openstack.org/112880 (Cinder widget)
 - https://review.openstack.org/104063 (Namespace Administration)

******* INSTRUCTIONS TO USE ********
Simply cherry pick the latest patch set from this review
onto your local horizon after you've pulled / fetched / etc
any of the above reviews.

Then do the following:
 **Assumption: Devstack running and Horizon is in /opt/stack/horizon

cd /opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/api/temp_mock_metadefs/
cat mock_glance.py >> ../glance.py

restart horizon: e.g. sudo service apache2 restart

Change-Id: If28762fb6d5321c80f058504996fb63a65db1429
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/49/113049/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Neutron network node

In Debian, debconf takes care of selecting the correct plug-in, and
there is no specific plug-in packages (they are all contained within
python-neutron and neutron-common). This patch fixes the procedure
for Debian, and also displays the screenshot which was removed
somehow.

Change-Id: I593b3705e8e5c8ef9f0f3e3cfe88bf59554ff30c
Closes-bug: #1324552
Backport: icehouse
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/87/96687/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <step os="debian"> <para>During the installation, you will also be prompted for which Networking plug-in to use. This will automatically fill the <option>core_plugin</option> directive in the <filename>/etc/neutron/neutron.conf</filename> file.</para> <informalfigure> <mediaobject> <imageobject> <imagedata scale="50" fileref="figures/debconf-screenshots/neutron_1_plugin_selection.png" /> </imageobject> </mediaobject> </informalfigure> <para>If the ML2 plug-in is selected, then the <option>core_plugin</option> option will be filled with <literal>neutron.plugins.ml2.plugin.Ml2Plugin</literal>, which is the full class name for the ML2 plug-in. In Debian, you cannot (yet) use the short names for the plug-ins. The <option>service_plugins</option> and <option>allow_overlapping_ips</option> options are filled with the appropriate values by default, so it is fine to not touch them.</para> </step> <step os="ubuntu">

commit_message:
Add domains for v3 authentication

I was having trouble authenticating with devstack identity v3 without domain.
These options make it possible.

Change-Id: I2a968a89136e72898dc086b8f5330608c31ec66f

commit_message:
Removed references to  tenant id/project id from docs and samples

Cleaned up whitespaces in WADL and fixed additional typos

Author: Constanze Kratel

Change-Id: I9348bcbb6e9febf61654d5312edf6dece06a489f

commit_message:
Introduces example of running a method on a resource

Example provides support for invoking arbirary methods on a resource object.

Change-Id: Ib07a974f188c76690ab7cd43cbfda503a5e81b9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/12/115112/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Example Action Command Invoke an action method on a resource. A session will be provided to the method if needed. For examples: python -m examples.action openstack/telemetry/v2/alarm.py \ --data '{"alarm_id": "33109eea-24dd-45ff-93f7-82292d1dd38c", "action": "change_state", "next_state": "insufficient data"}' python -m examples.action openstack/compute/v2/server.py \ --data '{"id": "a1369557-748f-429c-bd3e-fc385aacaec7", "action": "reboot", "reboot_type": "SOFT"}' """ import inspect import sys from examples import common from examples import session def filter_args(method, params): expected_args = inspect.getargspec(method).args accepted_args = ([a for a in expected_args if a != 'self']) filtered_args = {desired: params[desired] for desired in accepted_args} return filtered_args def invoke_method(method_name, target, params): action = getattr(target, method_name) filtered_args = filter_args(action, params) reply = action(**filtered_args) return reply def run_action(opts): sess = session.make_session(opts) cls = common.find_resource_cls(opts) data = common.get_data_option(opts) obj = cls.new(**data) data.update(session=sess) action = data['action'] reply = invoke_method(action, obj, data) print(str(reply)) return if __name__ == "__main__": opts = common.setup() sys.exit(common.main(opts, run_action))

subject: VMware: Remove unnecessary deepcopy from rescue/unrescue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-29 11:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7af7475eb327ee2543789fc6535685ed15985b8a', 'message': "VMware: Remove unnecessary deepcopy from rescue/unrescue

Commit 8db2f23a introduced a deepcopy of the instance object (then a
dict), which it modified. At some point we stopped modifying the
copied object, but we didn't remove the copy.

Change-Id: Id9597f3b414aa74c11e0dca3173853d857b81609
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Remove unnecessary deepcopy from rescue/unrescue

Commit 8db2f23a introduced a deepcopy of the instance object (then a
dict), which it modified. At some point we stopped modifying the
copied object, but we didn't remove the copy.

Change-Id: Id9597f3b414aa74c11e0dca3173853d857b81609
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/117747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _call_method, _power_off, _destroy_instance): _power_off.assert_called_once_with(self._session, self._instance, _destroy_instance.assert_called_once_with(self._instance,
deleted_lines: import copy r_instance = copy.deepcopy(self._instance) mock.patch.object(copy, 'deepcopy', return_value=r_instance) _call_method, _power_off, _destroy_instance, _deep_copy): _power_off.assert_called_once_with(self._session, r_instance, _destroy_instance.assert_called_once_with(r_instance,

subject: Make DHCP provider pluggable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-06 16:36:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/30ef7c59c7444b9356f843510d18b51d99eac393', 'message': 'Make DHCP provider pluggable

Previously, all dhcp was done explicitly through Neutron.  This commit
adds an interface for dhcp providers, currently implemented by a
Neutron provider and a noop provider.

The provider can be set in the dhcp_provider config option, and
defaults to neutron.

Implements: blueprint support-external-dhcp
Change-Id: I7eea490c573914c6cd2a73056fe3a0ec91065dc0

commit_message:
Make DHCP provider pluggable

Previously, all dhcp was done explicitly through Neutron.  This commit
adds an interface for dhcp providers, currently implemented by a
Neutron provider and a noop provider.

The provider can be set in the dhcp_provider config option, and
defaults to neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint support-external-dhcp
Closes-Bug: #1282168
Change-Id: I7eea490c573914c6cd2a73056fe3a0ec91065dc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/51/112351/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ironic.dhcp = neutron = ironic.dhcp.neutron:NeutronDHCPApi none = ironic.dhcp.none:NoneDHCPApi

commit_message:
DRAC wsman_{enumerate, invoke}() to return an ElementTree object

Before the method Client.wsman_enumerate() from the DRAC driver was
returning a list of XMLs, this commit changes that behavior and instead
of returning a list it will now merge all the XMLs into one and return
the result ElementTree object to facilitate the manipulation of that
XML on the other end.

Related: blueprint drac-management-driver
Change-Id: I0e662794afe933ef57268aba975aec1fbed70846

added_lines: from xml.etree import ElementTreefrom ironic.tests.drivers.drac import utils as test_utils mock_root = mock.Mock() mock_root.string.return_value = '<test></test>' mock_xml.root.return_value = mock_root mock_root = mock.Mock() mock_root.string.side_effect = [test_utils.build_soap_xml( {'item1': 'test1'}), test_utils.build_soap_xml( {'item2': 'test2'})] mock_xml.root.return_value = mock_root result = client.wsman_enumerate(resource_uri, mock_options) # assert the XML was merged result_string = ElementTree.tostring(result) self.assertIn('<item1>test1</item1>', result_string) self.assertIn('<item2>test2</item2>', result_string) mock_root = mock.Mock() mock_root.string.return_value = '<test></test>' mock_xml = mock.Mock() mock_xml.root.return_value = mock_root mock_pywsman_client.invoke.return_value = mock_xml

commit_message:
Prevent httpd binding to 0.0.0.0

Ensure apache is not listening to the Controller virtual IP to avoid a
clash with haproxy, this change is in place for source installations
but wasn't present for package installs.

Change-Id: I18479d3229f389ea9d4b2b8b4c29324712e040ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/98/115898/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure apache doesn't listen to the Controller virtual IP TEMPLATE_ROOT=$(os-apply-config --print-templates) sed -i '/Listen/s/^/#/g' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf mkdir -p $TEMPLATE_ROOT/etc/httpd/conf.d/ install -m 0644 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../files/ports.conf $TEMPLATE_ROOT/etc/httpd/conf.d/

commit_message:
Support for Extensions in ML2

This patch adds more detail to describe extension driver and how it works.

Change-Id: Ice45fab7a462fec02be17bb87d5fd5a2b82b31f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/12/114412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This proposal adds support to ML2 for extension drivers, which manage extended attributes on the neutron core resources implemented by the ML2 plugin: network, subnet and port. The extension drivers are completely orthogonal to mechanism drivers. An operator configures some set of extension drivers and configures some other set of mechanism drivers. The set of extension drivers configured determines what extended attributes are present on the core resources. These extension drivers manage setting, defaulting, updating and returning persistent values for these extended attributes. The values of these extended attributes are then available to all the configured mechanism drivers and they do not vary depending on which mechanism driver is using the extended attributes. If a mechanism driver understands an extension, it can enforce its semantics. If not, it just ignores those extended attributes. Each mechanism driver that requires a vendor-specific extension would have its own extension driver. There may also be "community" extension drivers, where several different mechanism drivers might be able to enforce the extension's semantics. What follows describe changes in ML2 to define extension drivers and provide support for extensions in ML2 mechanism drivers:
deleted_lines: The following changes can be considered as a solution to support extensions in mechanism driver:

commit_message:
Add kombu_reconnect_delay

The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect
 to MQ provider. This is used in some cases where you may need to wait
 for the provider to propery premote the master before attempting to
 reconnect.

Change-Id: I1966d9b018d056ccfe6c6346e42c4cf0ff01caa2
closes-bug: #1340310
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/16/106116/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*kombu_reconnect_delay*] # (optional) The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect # to MQ provider. This is used in some cases where you may need to wait # for the provider to propery premote the master before attempting to # reconnect. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76686 # Defaults to '1.0' # $kombu_reconnect_delay = '1.0', 'DEFAULT/rabbit_userid': value => $rabbit_user; 'DEFAULT/rabbit_password': value => $rabbit_password; 'DEFAULT/rabbit_virtual_host': value => $rabbit_virtual_host; 'DEFAULT/rabbit_use_ssl': value => $rabbit_use_ssl; 'DEFAULT/kombu_reconnect_delay': value => $kombu_reconnect_delay;

commit_message:
Stop substituting jsonutils as a anyjson reference impl

Since jsonutils is copied across many many different projects
and libraries it does not seem safe or smart to have that file
each time it is imported to force anyjson that this newly
loaded module is the de-facto json impl. This is especially
problematic since jsonutils loads and dumps do specific things
that are mainly openstack specific and now those openstack
specific adjustments become forced onto any library that also
uses anyjson...

This is especially problematic now that jsonutils has
conditionals like the following in dumps():

if is_simplejson:
    kwargs['namedtuple_as_object'] = False

Now all other anyjson using modules or libraries are affected by
this decision to do this, whether they like that or not...

Change-Id: I4faf2e4ef64dd5f666dfe42bd5f26b12b3daa73e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/07/117707/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: 3) This sets up anyjson to use the loads() and dumps() wrappers if anyjson is available. try: import anyjson except ImportError: pass else: anyjson._modules.append((__name__, 'dumps', TypeError, 'loads', ValueError, 'load')) anyjson.force_implementation(__name__)

commit_message:
Use ResourceDefinition as 'before' in resource updates

Replace the use of Resource.parsed_template() in updates with a frozen
version of a ResourceDefinition that uses the property values stored in the
database from the last update/create action, rather than calculated from
the template.

Change-Id: Id23ad60fbf98f2740ece2a337e795cfb3959d6f8
Implements: partial-blueprint update-failure-recovery

commit_message:
Additional exception type check for ceilo-client

This adds additional exception type checking for ceilometer client.
In addition to previous HTTPNotFound exception, ceilometer client lib
may throw an apiclient.NotFound exception directly.  Both cases should
be treated as 'valid' results from HTTP 404, so that the
ignore-not-found logic in Heat can work using either version of
ceilometer client.

Change-Id: Iedd061afe0cf039d5070257caf0d5a726213a8af
Closes-Bug: 1361128

commit_message:
Pass an empty context to the notifier

The notifier API expects a context as a first parameter. During the port
to oslo.messaging, a bug was introduced here and the first argument in
the notifier call was removed. This patch puts it back.

Change-Id: Id2f47757ee4af8f8c39a8a1e6b11dcad163f5b7b
Closes-bug: #1346466

commit_message:
Truncate instead of deleting log files

For package installs we need to be able to fix up permissions in
/var/log at install time, and if we delete all of the files then
those permission fixes get lost.  To deal with that, we can just
empty the files instead of deleting them.

Change-Id: I70abb354e4dc726ec7a176694c7c6e9455d89d08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/46/117046/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/07/117107/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <section xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="section_keystone-keyring-support"> <title>Keyring support</title> <para>A user specifies their username and password credentials to interact with Openstack, using any client command. These credentials can be specified using various mechanisms, namely, the environment variable, or command line argument. It is not safe to specify the password using either of these methods. </para> <para>For example, if a password is specified using the command line client with --<parameter>os-password</parameter> argument, it is saved as plain text in the <parameter>ps</parameter> field.</para> <para>To avoid this, if a password is not specified using either the environment variable or CLI, the Openstack password is prompted interactively. To prevent the user from having to enter the password every time, the password is stored in keyring when the user interactively enters the password for the first time. From the next time, the password is retrieved from keyring.</para> <note> <para>The encrypted password is stored in the <filename>~/.openstack-keyring.cfg </filename> file.</para> <para>Keyring is used only if --<parameter>os-use-keyring</parameter> is specified or if the environment variable <parameter>OS_USE_KEYRING = true </parameter> is defined.</para> </note> </section>

commit_message:
Unified the redirect matching being done for prior versions.

Updated the .htaccess file to show the same consistency for
different versions of OpenStack that are no longer supported -
specifically updating the bexar/cactus/diablo releases which were
previously only redirecting to the /trunk/ directory.

Change-Id: I844e1fbee4542a0d230a2bbf4e70963d1e626316

commit_message:
Allow operator to disable Swift ring building.

The default method for updating Swift rings - such as adding new
nodes to existing rings - is to do the update manually and then
distribute the new rings to all Swift nodes.  At the moment Heat
builds rings by default when a Swift node is brought up.  We do
not want this to happen when Heat is being used to bring up new
Swift nodes for inclusion in an existing overcloud Swift cluster.
This patch checks for a piece of meta-data swift.ring-build,
which defaults to True.  If instead the metadata is set to False
or F then Swift rings will not be built.  The metadata can be
set to False or F by an operator at the heat command-line, in
particular at heat update to an existing overcloud stack.

Change-Id: Ia2544d560b20d895b3b0b19bc7c91542ad58509d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/29/109029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BUILD_RINGS=$(os-apply-config --key swift.ring-build --key-default "True") if [ "$BUILD_RINGS" == "False" ] || [ "$BUILD_RINGS" == "F" ]; then echo "Won't build rings" exit 0 fi

subject: Retype can return a model_update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-13 19:11:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d2629e17dc4d4399337b75d2fb0a067ae064ddb5', 'message': "Retype can return a model_update

Make retype API allow a return of (boolean, model_update) and make it
backwards compatible (just boolean still works).

boolean is the current True|False which indicates whether a retype
happened.

model_update is a dict containing keys to update for the volume if the
retype happened. This implementation will be just like other existing
APIs (e.g., migrate_volume) and should be a familiar concept. The only
difference here is that we should still support old implementations that
return just a boolean so that we won't break them.

This fix will be needed once the pool implementation adds pool as a host
suffix. Retype can use an alternative pool, so it would like to update
the model.

Implements: blueprint retype-model-update
Partially Implements: blueprint pool-aware-cinder-scheduler

Change-Id: Ifeb82198c2ff85a40a9e1bfea9e414631c6bb25f

commit_message:
Retype can return a model_update

Make retype API allow a return of (boolean, model_update).

boolean is the current True|False which indicates whether a retype
happened.

model_update is a dict containing keys to update for the volume if the
retype happened. This implementation will be just like other existing
APIs (e.g., migrate_volume) and should be a familiar concept.  Use
None for model_update to let the manager do the usual model updates.
Return a model_update dict if the driver needs to override some of the
values.

The existing implementations have been updated to use the new return
signature.  They all return None for the model_update.  Drivers will
add model_update specifics as needed in separate path sets.

This fix will be needed once the pool implementation adds pool as a host
suffix. Retype can use an alternative pool, so it would like to update
the model in some cases.

This will similarly be needed for replication.

Implements: blueprint retype-model-update
Partially Implements: blueprint pool-aware-cinder-scheduler

Change-Id: Ifeb82198c2ff85a40a9e1bfea9e414631c6bb25f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/97/113997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _retype_volume_exec(self, driver_result, snap=False, policy='on-demand', migrate_exc=False, exc=None, diff_equal=False): if isinstance(driver_result, bool): driver = driver_result model_update = None else: driver, model_update = driver_result _retype.return_value = driver_result if driver and model_update and 'host' in model_update: self.assertEqual(volume['host'], model_update['host']) else: self.assertEqual(volume['host'], CONF.host) self.assertEqual(volume['host'].partition(':')[0], CONF.host) def test_retype_volume_driver_success_no_model_update(self): self._retype_volume_exec((True, None)) def test_retype_volume_driver_success_model_update(self): self._retype_volume_exec( (True, {'host': ":".join((CONF.host, "pool1"))})) def test_retype_volume_driver_fail_no_model_update(self): self._retype_volume_exec((False, None)) def test_retype_volume_driver_fail_model_update(self): self._retype_volume_exec((False, {'host': 'ignore-this'}))
deleted_lines: def _retype_volume_exec(self, driver, snap=False, policy='on-demand', migrate_exc=False, exc=None, diff_equal=False): _retype.return_value = driver self.assertEqual(volume['host'], CONF.host)

commit_message:
Add missing create() method on SecurityGroupRule object

The nova.objects.SecurityGroupRule class was missing the
create() method, so we add it here, and while doing so,
ensure that the id attribute is marked as read-only.

Partial-Blueprint: compute-manager-objects-juno
Change-Id: I4584e33d9d163a7dce01b01d205f2f43824e544f

commit_message:
Heal script: Drop fks before operating on columns

This patch fixes a small glitch in the healing script.
If the script detects that a foreign key must be removed,
and the columns that it references must be removed as well,
then the foreign key removal would fail as the column would
not exist anymore.

This patch simply ensures foreign key are dropped before all
the remaining table/column operations. New foreign keys are
instead added after all table/column operations are completed.

Change-Id: I3cce742146c70b71900cf53e50f9a6a61bc6a378
Closes-Bug: # 1354188

added_lines: added_fks, dropped_fks = check_foreign_keys(models_metadata) diff = dropped_fks + diff1 + added_fks added_fks = [] dropped_fks = [] dropped_fks.append(('drop_key', fk_db[key], table)) added_fks.append(('add_key', fk_models[key])) return (added_fks, dropped_fks)
deleted_lines: # This is needed else the heal script will start spewing # a lot of pointless warning messages from alembic. diff2 = check_foreign_keys(models_metadata) diff = diff1 + diff2 diff = [] diff.append(('drop_key', fk_db[key], table)) diff.append(('add_key', fk_models[key])) return diff

commit_message:
VMware: initial support for SPBM

This patch adds additional service for access to the Storage Policy API
in vSphere. All vSphere services inherit from a base class that provides
common functionality for making API calls. Service objects are created
once and then stored in the VMwareAPISession.

This is the first part of the blueprint vmware-spbm-support

Co-authored-by: Subramanian Neelakantan <sneelakantan@vmware.com>
Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I1356163f103b962d62e1b63d0f68ff608073bd7b

added_lines: def convert_datastores_to_hubs(pbm_client_factory, datastores): """Convert Datastore morefs to PbmPlacementHub morefs. :param pbm_client_factory: pbm client factory :param datastores: list of datastore morefs :return: list of PbmPlacementHub morefs """ hubs = [] for ds in datastores: hub = pbm_client_factory.create('ns0:PbmPlacementHub') hub.hubId = ds.value hub.hubType = 'Datastore' hubs.append(hub) return hubs def _extract_hub_ids(hubs): """Return an array of hub id strings extracted from hub morefs. :param hubs: array of PbmPlacementHub morefs :return: array of hub id strings """ return [hub.hubId for hub in hubs] def convert_hubs_to_datastores(hubs, datastores): """Get filtered subset of datastores as represented by hubs. :param hubs: represents a sub set of datastore ids :param datastores: represents all candidate datastores :return: that subset of datastores objects that are also present in hubs """ filtered_dss = [] hubIds = _extract_hub_ids(hubs) for ds in datastores: if ds.value in hubIds: filtered_dss.append(ds) return filtered_dss

commit_message:
sort Create Node Group Template's Flavor List

The Flavor dropdown menu should be sorted and make use of
the CREATE_INSTANCE_FLAVOR_SORT in local_settings.py.

Change-Id: I42b3a98a17ff188c9ea817c5a344d77076ecafc6
Closes-Bug: #1361871

commit_message:
Modified APIClient to not call nailgun during initialization

* changed error messages and help description
* modified APIClient to call nailgun only during requests
* modified the credential arguments to work correctly
* added tests

Change-Id: Ida542ac3c393b653331a38b06e12964dc9588abd
Closes-Bug: #1348395

commit_message:
Upgrades, add keystone authentification for ostf checker

In case if there is problem with conectivity between
ostf and keystone container, ostf checker won't catch
and user can get broken ostf.

* created separate module clients
* extracted keystone client in separate class
* added ostf client which uses keystone authentification

Closes-bug: #1363054
Change-Id: If5bd2fb6a5736bd043171489ef9615f376a9ed75

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import requests from fuel_upgrade.clients import KeystoneClient from fuel_upgrade.tests import base class TestKeystoneClient(base.BaseTestCase): token = {'access': {'token': {'id': 'auth_token'}}} def setUp(self): self.credentials = { 'username': 'some_user', 'password': 'some_password', 'auth_url': 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2', 'tenant_name': 'some_tenant'} self.keystone = KeystoneClient(**self.credentials) @mock.patch('fuel_upgrade.clients.keystone_client.requests.post') @mock.patch('fuel_upgrade.clients.keystone_client.requests.Session') def test_makes_authenticated_requests(self, session, post_mock): post_mock.return_value.json.return_value = self.token self.keystone.request session.return_value.headers.update.assert_called_once_with( {'X-Auth-Token': 'auth_token'}) @mock.patch('fuel_upgrade.clients.keystone_client.requests.Session') @mock.patch('fuel_upgrade.clients.keystone_client.requests.post', side_effect=requests.exceptions.HTTPError('')) def test_does_not_fail_without_keystone(self, _, __): self.keystone.request self.assertEqual(self.keystone.get_token(), None)

commit_message:
Sort image states in test case

Just comparing two lists of states by sorting them first
because their order really isn't important, and dict.values()
makes no guarantees about the order it returns its list anyway.

Change-Id: I92388720026a400a7ec7b07594f0d3c1a1dd4962

commit_message:
Change external network settings to not shared

External network should not be shared with other users. Only admin
user should have the privilege to access external network. The
other tenants can access the external network via. router.

Change-Id: I599b8a21323298c8668666b2476f11a81a65165e

commit_message:
Deal with syslinux version 6

Dependencies have changed such that syslinux-common is no longer
installed by default.  It contains necessary files for pxe booting, so
we need to install it.

The pxelinux.0 also now has dependencies on modules that need to be
copied in.

And of course different distros are packaged differently.

Fixes-Bug: #1351010
Change-Id: I07c8a7ec3fce3c30bee382d46a11f459da946d05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/98/117798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Debian testing and f21 will have syslinux 6 in them, which means different packages, # and we also need to make sure that we copy the library modules into the tftpboot area if ( [[ "debian" =~ "$DISTRO_NAME" ]] && [[ "$DISTRO_RELEASE" =~ "testing" ]] ) ||\ ( [[ "fedora" =~ "$DISTRO_NAME" ]] && [[ "$DISTRO_RELEASE" =~ "21" ]] ); then install-packages -m ironic-conductor syslinux_dev_package syslinux_common_package # the syslinux-tftpboot package sorts f21, for debian we need to copy things in if [[ "fedora" =~ "$DISTRO_NAME" ]]; then install-packages -m ironic-conductor syslinux_tftpboot_package elif [[ "debian" =~ "$DISTRO_NAME" ]]; then pxe_zero="/usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /usr/lib/syslinux/modules/*/ldlinux.*" fi # setup tftp directory structure if [ -f /usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 ]; then # Ubuntu pxe_zero="/usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0" elif [ -f /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0 ]; then # Fedora/RHEL pxe_zero="/usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0" else echo "Failed to find pxelinux.0." exit 1 fiif [ -n "${pxe_zero:-}" ]; then install -o ironic -g ironic $pxe_zero /tftpboot/ fi
deleted_lines: # setup tftp directory structure if [ -f /usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 ]; then # Ubuntu pxe_zero="/usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0" elif [ -f /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0 ]; then # Fedora/RHEL pxe_zero="/usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0" echo "Failed to find pxelinux.0." exit 1install -o ironic -g ironic -m 744 $pxe_zero /tftpboot/pxelinux.0

commit_message:
Revert "Remove the word 'More' in the row actions split button"

This reverts commit f19d8a708d143412a03c459ee8409947fda279f7. The
"More" text had been added to mitigate existing UX issues, ideally we
shouldn't remove it without thinking up an alternative.

Change-Id: I4c70254584a3e2791c8062d9d9846da8018cd0ce
Related-Bug: #1357487

commit_message:
Add parent_project_id field

Field to point to a parent project. This enables
the possibility to use hierarchical projects.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Telles Mota Vidal Nobrega <tellesmvn@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy
Change-Id: I2b56a362df40b664e3a802d09ca027277678b300

commit_message:
Base methods to handle hierarchical projects

Add base methods to be used at hierarhical projects.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Telles Mota Vidal Nobrega <tellesmvn@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Andre Aranha <afaranha@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy
Change-Id: I70ffbf426af5c3901dc2347efb9a43540f7d0604
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/41/111841/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_project_children(self): project1 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(project1['id'], project1) project2 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': project1['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project2['id'], project2) project3 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': project2['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project3['id'], project3) project4 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': project2['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project4['id'], project4) children = self.assignment_api.list_project_children(project1['id']) self.assertEqual(3, len(children)) self.assertIn(project2, children) self.assertIn(project3, children) self.assertIn(project4, children) children = self.assignment_api.list_project_children(project2['id']) self.assertEqual(2, len(children)) self.assertIn(project3, children) self.assertIn(project4, children) children = self.assignment_api.list_project_children(project3['id']) self.assertEqual(0, len(children)) def test_list_project_parents(self): project1 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(project1['id'], project1) project2 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': project1['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project2['id'], project2) project3 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': project2['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project3['id'], project3) parents = self.assignment_api.list_project_parents(project3['id']) self.assertEqual(2, len(parents)) self.assertIn(project1, parents) self.assertIn(project2, parents) parents = self.assignment_api.list_project_parents(project1['id']) self.assertEqual(0, len(parents)) def test_check_leaf_projects(self): root_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project['id'], root_project) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': root_project['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) self.assertFalse(self.assignment_api.is_leaf_project( root_project['id'])) self.assertTrue(self.assignment_api.is_leaf_project( leaf_project['id'])) # Delete leaf_project self.assignment_api.delete_project(leaf_project['id']) # Now, root_project should be leaf self.assertTrue(self.assignment_api.is_leaf_project( root_project['id']))

subject: Create, update and delete hierarchical projects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-04 21:39:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/ee890ee1c48deec3818bb4144a130f41c8e53436', 'message': 'Create, update and delete hierarchical projects

Changes at basic operations related to projects
were modified to handle projects hierarchy.

This changes includes:
- Create and update projects with parent_project_id
  field
- Avoid updating and deleting projects that are not
  leaf in the hierarchy
- Limit the max depth of a tree branch (in the
  hierarchy)

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Create, update and delete hierarchical projects

Changes at basic operations related to projects
were modified to handle projects hierarchy.

This changes includes:
- Create and update projects with parent_project_id
  field
- Avoid deleting projects that are not leaf in the
  hierarchy
- Deny the update of a project's parent
- Limit the max depth of a tree branch (in the
  hierarchy)

Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva Brito <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy
Change-Id: I036f7f67ae7d106ecb0de688d1125edfadf3f712
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/42/111842/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_hierarchical_projects_crud(self): root_project1 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project1['id'], root_project1) root_project2 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project2['id'], root_project2) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': root_project1['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) leaf_project['parent_project_id'] = root_project2['id'] self.assignment_api.update_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) self.assignment_api.delete_project(leaf_project['id']) self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.get_project, leaf_project['id']) self.assignment_api.delete_project(root_project1['id']) self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.get_project, root_project1['id']) self.assignment_api.delete_project(root_project2['id']) self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.get_project, root_project2['id']) def test_create_project_with_invalid_parent(self): project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': 'fake'} self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.create_project, project['id'], project) def test_delete_hierarchical_leaf_project(self): root_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project['id'], root_project) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': root_project['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) self.assignment_api.delete_project(leaf_project['id']) self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.get_project, leaf_project['id']) self.assignment_api.delete_project(root_project['id']) self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.get_project, root_project['id']) def test_delete_hierarchical_not_leaf_project(self): root_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project['id'], root_project) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': root_project['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) self.assertRaises(exception.ForbiddenAction, self.assignment_api.delete_project, root_project['id']) def test_update_not_leaf_project_parent_project_id(self): root_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project['id'], root_project) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': root_project['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) root_project['parent_project_id'] = 'fake' self.assertRaises(exception.ForbiddenAction, self.assignment_api.update_project, root_project['id'], root_project) def test_update_leaf_project_parent_project_id(self): root_project1 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project1['id'], root_project1) root_project2 = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project2['id'], root_project2) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': root_project1['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) leaf_project['parent_project_id'] = root_project2['id'] self.assignment_api.update_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) leaf_project_ref = self.assignment_api.get_project(leaf_project['id']) self.assertDictEqual(leaf_project_ref, leaf_project) def test_update_not_valid_parent_project_id(self): project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(project['id'], project) project['parent_project_id'] = 'fake' self.assertRaises(exception.ProjectNotFound, self.assignment_api.update_project, project['id'], project) def test_update_none_parent_project_id(self): root_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': None} self.assignment_api.create_project(root_project['id'], root_project) leaf_project = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'description': '', 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'enabled': True, 'parent_project_id': root_project['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) leaf_project['parent_project_id'] = None self.assignment_api.update_project(leaf_project['id'], leaf_project) leaf_project_ref = self.assignment_api.get_project(leaf_project['id']) self.assertDictEqual(leaf_project_ref, leaf_project) def _get_hierarchy_depth(self, project_id): return len(self.assignment_api.list_project_parents(project_id)) + 1 def test_create_project_depth_0(self): project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project1 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID} ref = self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project1) depth = self._get_hierarchy_depth(ref['id']) self.assertEqual(1, depth) def test_create_project_depth_3(self): project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project1 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID} ref = self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project1) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project2 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project1['id']} ref = self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project2) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project3 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project2['id']} ref = self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project3) depth = self._get_hierarchy_depth(ref['id']) self.assertEqual(3, depth) def test_create_project_depth_not_allowed(self): """This test verifies if 'CONF.max_project_tree_depth' is beeing verified on creating projects. The default value for this conf is 5 so, given that the root of the hierarchy if level 0, we'll reach the level 5 on the 6th project """ project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project1 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID} self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project1) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project2 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project1['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project2) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project3 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project2['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project3) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project4 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project3['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project4) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project5 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project4['id']} self.assignment_api.create_project(project_id, project5) project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project6 = { 'id': project_id, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, 'parent_project_id': project5['id']} self.assertRaises(exception.ForbiddenAction, self.assignment_api.create_project, project_id, project6) def test_update_project_depth_3(self): """This test verifies if 'CONF.max_project_tree_depth' is beeing verified on updating projects. commit_message:
Fix sideways grenade local tmp variables

These variables are not declared within any function and declaration
fails, causing the script to exit 1 and sideways jobs fail.

Change-Id: Ib49d34de7404a277ee949f9c2247477b417c6c62

commit_message:
Not able to delete a pseudo-folder via horizon

Through horizon the user not able to delete a
pseudo-folder. it giving a error message like
'you are not allowed to delete object'

problem-1:
'subfolders' datatype is not added in the
allowed datatypes tuple, so the delete operation
is not allowed for pseudo-folder. now the 'subfolder'
is added in the tuple.

problem-2:
the object name is starting with container name and
not trailing with '/'. now the object name is modified
before sending to swift client.(removing the container
name and trailing with '/'.

Change-Id: Ifced62b24a9b6e4800b70dae2912ff16d809743d
Closes-Bug: #1317016
Co-Authored-By: Mizielski Robert <robert.mizielski@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Fix downgrades in migration scripts 016 and 035

Downgrade behavior was not checked in Heat, so there are a few mistakes
in migration scripts. Fixed these scripts, set test attributes
`snake_walk` and `downgrade` to True due to allow migration testing and
avoid of regression.

Change-Id: I30cfb282cf7884d8b2748c6486a68d05072957af

commit_message:
Keep all exceptions in a separate file

All internal exceptions are moved to murano/common/exception.py

Closes blueprint murano-api-exception-handling

Change-Id: I5485a7f43ea7a18aef19ce7f1642801b71141c6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/53/116853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Murano exception subclasses""" import sys from six.moves.urllib import parse as urlparse from murano.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa from murano.openstack.common import log as logging _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS = False LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class RedirectException(Exception): def __init__(self, url): self.url = urlparse.urlparse(url) class MuranoException(Exception): """Base Murano Exception To correctly use this class, inherit from it and define a 'msg_fmt' property. That msg_fmt will get printf'd with the keyword arguments provided to the constructor. """ message = _("An unknown exception occurred.") def __init__(self, **kwargs): self.kwargs = kwargs try: self.message = self.msg_fmt % kwargs except KeyError: exc_info = sys.exc_info() #kwargs doesn't match a variable in the message #log the issue and the kwargs LOG.exception(_('Exception in string format operation')) for name, value in kwargs.iteritems(): LOG.error("%s: %s" % (name, value)) # noqa if _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS: raise exc_info[0], exc_info[1], exc_info[2] def __str__(self): return unicode(self.message).encode('UTF-8') def __unicode__(self): return unicode(self.message) def __deepcopy__(self, memo): return self.__class__(**self.kwargs) class AuthorizationFailure(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _("Authorization failed.") class Forbidden(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _("You are not authorized to complete this action.") class Invalid(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _("Data supplied was not valid: %(reason)s") class NotSupported(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _("%(feature)s is not supported.") class PackageLookupFailed(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _('Unable to find package definition') class PackageLoadError(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _('Unable to load package: %(reason)s') class PackageClassLoadError(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _('Unable to load class "%(class_name)s" ' 'from package: %(reason)s') class PackageUILoadError(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _('Unable to load ui definition from package') class PackageFormatError(MuranoException): msg_fmt = _('Incorrect package format: %(reason)s')

commit_message:
check for valid env name on update action

On environment create we check env name to ensure it is valid,
however env update action doesn't do this validation check, so we add
the validation action in this commit.

Change-Id: Ib6fb146880eaca850a458b74d808db8ad80ce527
Closes-Bug: 1362780

commit_message:
Add commas for ease of maintenance

Add commas to lists to make adding to the lists easier. This is
correcting some nits from earlier changesets.

Change-Id: I3ab3f230917e4f2156ba667e870dd92fd55c896e

commit_message:
Change v3 keypairs API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 keypairs API to v2.1 and makes v2 unit tests
share between v2 and v2.1.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3 .

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I1fcb93a00816eab2d87f251b7cf8a8992e920308

commit_message:
Push metadata changes to the TempURL

This changes EngineService._push_metadata_software_deployments
to push deployments metadata changes to any configured
TempURL as stored in the server resource data.

The server resource metadata is treated as the canonical
source of up-to-date metadata, so deployments data is always
merged with existing resource metadata before persisting to
the database.

Implements-Blueprint: swift-deployment-transport
Change-Id: I96698ac5796c3c5c4381750d9a6f2d6a790fe25b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/63/116163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import requestsfrom heat.openstack.common import jsonutils if not rs: return deployments = self.metadata_software_deployments(cnxt, server_id) md = rs.rsrc_metadata or {} md['deployments'] = deployments rs.update_and_save({'rsrc_metadata': md}) metadata_put_url = None for rd in rs.data: if rd.key == 'metadata_put_url': metadata_put_url = rd.value break if metadata_put_url: json_md = jsonutils.dumps(md) requests.put(metadata_put_url, json_md)
deleted_lines: if rs: deployments = self.metadata_software_deployments(cnxt, server_id) md = rs.rsrc_metadata or {} md['deployments'] = deployments rs.update_and_save({'rsrc_metadata': md})

commit_message:
Fix for setting a default display name during volume creation

When instance is booted by creating a new volume with image
as the source, nova instructs cinder to create a volume
without setting a display name. The change fixes this by
finding the display name of the source - image or vol
and using it as display name for the volume being created.

Change-Id: I61834eda06c14ba460a23ba13ad690082dc16c10
Closes-Bug: #1224972
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/111659/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When request to create a volume comes without a display name # for the volume, the following code retrieves the information # about the source and appends the keyword 'vol' to it. # If the source is image, find the image name, append string 'vol' to it # and use it as the display name for the volume being created. if not name: if image_id: images = self.image_service.detail(context) for image in images: if image['id'] == image_id: image_name = image['name'] break else: continue volume_name = image_name + 'vol' name = volume_name elif source_volume: name = source_volume['display_name'] + 'vol'

commit_message:
Remove unneeded definitions of Python Source Code Encoding

PEP 0263 (http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0263/) is not
used anywhere else and should be removed when it's not needed.

Change-Id: I08aa9e8e740c5f6506a76aaf5bea3402f97ac41a

commit_message:
Add extended logging options.

There is a range of extended logging options in Openstack services that use
openstack.common.logger (Ceilometer, Cinder, Heat, Keystone, Nova). Adding
ceilometer::logging to support them.

No blueprint/spec, as discussed in the IRC meeting on 08-11-2014.

Change-Id: I910e2f9e4f3ad1991d58ba6df16adfbc85e20131
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/60/113560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'ceilometer::logging' do let :log_params do { :logging_context_format_string => '%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(process)d %(levelname)s %(name)s [%(request_id)s %(user_identity)s] %(instance)s%(message)s', :logging_default_format_string => '%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(process)d %(levelname)s %(name)s [-] %(instance)s%(message)s', :logging_debug_format_suffix => '%(funcName)s %(pathname)s:%(lineno)d', :logging_exception_prefix => '%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(process)d TRACE %(name)s %(instance)s', :log_config_append => '/etc/ceilometer/logging.conf', :publish_errors => true, :default_log_levels => 'amqp=WARN,amqplib=WARN,boto=WARN,qpid=WARN,sqlalchemy=WARN,suds=INFO,iso8601=WARN,requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool=WARN', :fatal_deprecations => true, :instance_format => '[instance: %(uuid)s] ', :instance_uuid_format => '[instance: %(uuid)s] ', :log_date_format => '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', } end shared_examples_for 'ceilometer::logging' do context 'with extended logging options' do before { params.merge!( log_params ) } it_configures 'logging params set' end context 'without extended logging options' do it_configures 'logging params unset' end end shared_examples_for 'logging params set' do params.keys { |key| it { should contain_ceilometer_config("DEFAULT/#{key}").with_value( params[key] ) } } end shared_examples_for 'logging params unset' do params.keys { |key| it { should contain_ceilometer_config("DEFAULT/#{key}").with_ensure('absent') } } end end

subject: Unlock the kazoo version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-28 18:50:41.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/54dd71907989fa194f5cf71c25e5208c76df1f4d', 'message': "Unlock the kazoo version

Latching on to an exact version is going to make it for consumers
of tooz+kazoo, which may themselves use a newer version, to be able
to correctly install tooz.

I'm also pretty sure there isn't any reason to bind to exactly 1.3.1
and allowing newer versions (which for now is up to 2.0) should be
fine.

Change-Id: I0dc810c2d9dbf5ff04cb5000b843ad4ac772fc43
"}]
commit_message:
Unlock the kazoo version

Latching on to an exact version is going to make it for consumers
of tooz+kazoo, which may themselves use a newer version, to be able
to correctly install tooz.

I'm also pretty sure there isn't any reason to bind to exactly 1.3.1
and allowing newer versions (which for now is up to 2.0) should be
fine.

Change-Id: I0dc810c2d9dbf5ff04cb5000b843ad4ac772fc43

commit_message:
fix package download file extension

When downloading a package, the filename contains .package extension
which is if no use. This commit changes the file ext to .zip so that
when downloaded the package archive can be unzipped

Change-Id: I522c5e4601175b29404035f285595fe24cd31a0f
Closes-Bug: 1362777

commit_message:
Notification cleanup: namespace actions

Update the notification actions to be properly namespaced  rather than
simple constant strings. This is a followup to the general notification
constant cleanup changeset.

Change-Id: Ife7597eba4a797b6909acd76720e46ee20a91727

commit_message:
Make persistence manager in token_provider_api private

The token_provider_api persistence manager is now private this is
to ensure clear control over how the token persistence is utilized
and allowing for toggling when fully non-persistent tokens are
supported.

Change-Id: Id2bc82ee6d77201c5d1d868aa7584b3553fba97a
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Add extra guarding to revoke_by_audit_id methods

Guard against an event that is both project and domain scoped in the
revoke by audit_id and revoke by audit_chain_id methods.

Change-Id: Ia2f562a47551cffd9d4e5bd630ff7d55d8c7aef8
bp: non-persistent-tokens

This is a bug in the Keystone server. commit_message:
Mark methods on token_api deprecated

Mark the methods on token_api as deprecated. The versionutils.deprecated
decorator will only work with functions and classes (meaning it cannot
be applied to instance methods post instantiation). A log line is used
that should only trigger once per object on token_api instead of the
versionutils decorator.

Change-Id: I97c96c239262697b0df37ef895c4bafa262892e0
bp: non-persistent-tokens
bp: deprecated-as-of-juno

added_lines: from keystone.i18n import _LW LOG.warning(_LW('`token_api.%s` is deprecated as of Juno in favor of ' 'utilizing methods on `token_provider_api` and may be ' 'removed in Kilo.'), item)
deleted_lines: # TODO(morganfainberg): Once the `token_api` is deprecated, apply a # @versionutils.deprecated decorator to each item forwarded.

commit_message:
Remove SAML2 plugin dependency on token_api

Remove the SAML2 auth plugin's dependency on the token_api by utilizing
the token_provider_api.validate_token instead of token_api.get_token and
leveraging the KeystoneToken model instead of doing direct lookups on the
dictionary returned.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence system
are consistent and supporting the ability to toggle token persistence
in the future.

Change-Id: I1a38156ff5535e1dd52460040891ad50500d4c71
bp: non-persistent-tokens

deleted_lines: @dependency.requires('federation_api', 'identity_api', 'token_api') token_ref = self.token_api.get_token(auth_payload['id']) _federation = token_ref['user'][federation.FEDERATION] identity_provider = _federation['identity_provider']['id'] protocol = _federation['protocol']['id'] group_ids = [group['id'] for group in _federation['groups']] identity_provider, protocol) utils.validate_groups(group_ids, mapping['id'], self.identity_api) return { 'user_id': token_ref['user_id'], 'group_ids': group_ids, federation.IDENTITY_PROVIDER: identity_provider, federation.PROTOCOL: protocol

deleted_lines: # lib/cinder_plugins/solidfire # Configure the solidfire driver # Enable with: # # CINDER_DRIVER=solidfire # Dependencies: # # - ``functions`` file # - ``cinder`` configurations # configure_cinder_driver - make configuration changes, including those to other services # Save trace setting MY_XTRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Defaults # -------- # Set up default directories # Entry Points # ------------ # configure_cinder_driver - Set config files, create data dirs, etc function configure_cinder_driver { # To use solidfire, set the following in localrc: # CINDER_DRIVER=solidfire # SAN_IP=<mvip> # SAN_LOGIN=<cluster-admin-account> # SAN_PASSWORD=<cluster-admin-password> iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT volume_driver "cinder.volume.drivers.solidfire.SolidFireDriver" iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT san_ip $SAN_IP iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT san_login $SAN_LOGIN iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT san_password $SAN_PASSWORD } # Restore xtrace $MY_XTRACE # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
Add support for security-group-default-rules

Add API & CLI support for security-group-default-rules. Security group
default rules allows users to create, delete, list, and get rules that
will be pre-populated into the Security Group "default" that is
populated in all projects on creation. This feature was intoduced in
Grizzly.

This commit also includes a small typo fix in the security_group_rules fake.

Change-Id: I6722b659934bde34bd206103f92dbd2cc42b1537
Closes-Bug: #1326941
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/20/98620/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from novaclient import exceptions from novaclient.tests import utils from novaclient.tests.v1_1 import fakes from novaclient.v1_1 import security_group_default_rules cs = fakes.FakeClient() class SecurityGroupDefaultRulesTest(utils.TestCase): def test_delete_security_group_default_rule(self): cs.security_group_default_rules.delete(1) cs.assert_called('DELETE', '/os-security-group-default-rules/1') def test_create_security_group_default_rule(self): sg = cs.security_group_default_rules.create("tcp", 1, 65535, "10.0.0.0/16") body = { "security_group_default_rule": { "ip_protocol": "tcp", "from_port": 1, "to_port": 65535, "cidr": "10.0.0.0/16", } } cs.assert_called('POST', '/os-security-group-default-rules', body) self.assertTrue(isinstance(sg, security_group_default_rules.SecurityGroupDefaultRule)) def test_list_security_group_default_rules(self): rules = cs.security_group_default_rules.list() self.assertEqual(1, len(rules)) self.assertEqual(22, rules[0].to_port) self.assertEqual(22, rules[0].from_port) self.assertEqual('TCP', rules[0].ip_protocol) self.assertEqual('10.0.0.0/8', rules[0].cidr) def test_invalid_parameters_create(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, cs.security_group_default_rules.create, "invalid_ip_protocol", 1, 65535, "10.0.0.0/16") self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, cs.security_group_default_rules.create, "tcp", "invalid_from_port", 65535, "10.0.0.0/16") self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, cs.security_group_default_rules.create, "tcp", 1, "invalid_to_port", "10.0.0.0/16") def test_security_group_default_rule_str(self): sg = cs.security_group_default_rules.create("tcp", 1, 65535, "10.0.0.0/16") self.assertEqual('1', str(sg)) def test_security_group_default_rule_del(self): sg = cs.security_group_default_rules.create("tcp", 1, 65535, "10.0.0.0/16") sg.delete() cs.assert_called('DELETE', '/os-security-group-default-rules/1')

Add filter to admin image panel

The snapshot images will be separated from all
images set by image type.

Change-Id: I312c651cfc1b97fe44eb887eccaf30e2b6da5b9e
Closes-Bug:#1250740

added_lines: from collections import defaultdict def load_cells(self, image=None): super(UpdateRow, self).load_cells(image) image = self.datum category = get_image_type(image) self.classes.append('category-' + category) class AdminImageTypeFilter(tables.FixedFilterAction): def get_fixed_buttons(self): def make_dict(text, imagetype, icon): return dict(text=text, value=imagetype, icon=icon) buttons = [make_dict(_('Image'), 'image', 'icon-home'), make_dict(_('Snapshot'), 'snapshot', 'icon-camera')] return buttons def categorize(self, table, images): imagetypes = defaultdict(list) for im in images: category = get_image_type(im) imagetypes[category].append(im) return imagetypes def get_image_type(im): return getattr(im, "properties", {}).get("image_type", "image") table_actions = (AdminImageTypeFilter, AdminCreateImage, AdminDeleteImage)

single switch, the nexus driver would never know about the second
connection because the nexus_dict stored the interface as a single
value, which would just get overwritten.  This has been fixed by
allowing the port value to be a comma seperated list.  All
operations on ports have been update to loop over multiple ports
per switch. New test added for host with dual connections to one
switch.

Change-Id: Iefb30452083747b45496600c81f8d0a6f378bd08
Closes-Bug: 1288393

commit_message:
Change nexus_dict to accept port lists

When users configured a server to have two logical connections to a
single switch, the nexus driver would never know about the second
connection because the nexus_dict stored the interface as a single
value, which would just get overwritten.  This has been fixed by
allowing the port value to be a comma seperated list.  All
operations on ports have been update to loop over multiple ports
per switch. New test added for host with dual connections to one
switch.

Change-Id: Iefb30452083747b45496600c81f8d0a6f378bd08
Closes-Bug: 1288393

commit_message:
Fix of wrong neutron.conf parameter for NSX plugin

Remove line "service_plugins=" from generated neutron.conf
when deploying with NSX plugin, cause deployment fails otherwise.

Change-Id: Ibe6e8a27fbf2c57e3ac10a52663b0d4496e4c933
Closes-bug: #1362317

commit_message:
Switch to using SysV semaphores to allow safe process termination

SysV semaphores have SEM_UNDO flag that will undo changes done to a
semaphore by this process.

Closes-Bug: #1327946
Change-Id: I2ee6046344cace7a80c5d5ae67e53304be5755db

Updates HACKING.rst in training-guides/labs

Adds details for using the osbash scripts
in labs section for development purpose.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/86/117486/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Structure --------- **autostart** osbash/wbatch copy shell scripts (*.sh) into this directory to have them automatically executed (and removed) upon boot. **config** Contains the configuration files for all the scripts. The setup can be customized here. **img** By default osbash will put into this directory its base disk images (base-*-<distro>.vdi), the VM export images (oslabs-<distro>.ova), and all installation ISO images it may download. **lib** This directory contains bash libraries used by scripts. **log** Contains the log files written (and removed) by osbash/wbatch and the scripts running within the VMs. **scripts** All scripts in this directory run within the VMs. **wbatch** Files in this directory are Windows batch files generated by osbash to configure host-only networks, produce a base disk, and build OpenStack training-labs VMs as configured when osbash created them. TODO ---- Etherpad: - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/training-guides-developing-topics

commit_message:
Add spec for policy-compare-kind-with-match

Add new rule check 'ParameterEqualityCheck' in policy module to compare
the rule on the basis of equality i.e. 'kind' is equal to 'match'.

blueprint: policy-compare-kind-with-match

Change-Id: I8c8d18f3dde73cc4401906ce0d4c59075abba1c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/85/106285/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================== policy.json - Comparing kind against match ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo/+spec/policy-compare-kind-with-match Add comparison check in GenericCheck class of policy module to compare the rule on the basis of 'kind' and 'match'. For example, if rule in policy.json is configured as: 'sample_rule': 'test_1234:%(test_key)s' then test_1234 == %(test_key)s should return True if %(test_key)s has value 'test_1234', where 'test_1234' is 'kind' and '%(test_key)s' is 'match'. Problem description =================== As of now if you want to do the comparison of 'kind' and 'match', you need to pass this data in the 'credential' and then match it. 'credential' is a dictionary which consist of information about users, tenants and roles. So if the comparison need to be done on the basis of image or instance properties, you need to pass these properties explicitly through the 'credential' dictionary, otherwise 'KeyError' will be raised as this information is not present in the 'credential' dictionary and the particular policy rule will not work as per expectation. Proposed change =============== In GenericCheck class, we will add a simple check to compare 'kind' with 'match'. If this comparison is matched then it will return True or else it will compare using 'credential' dictionary. For example, if self.kind == match: return True Alternatives ------------ The alternative would be, instead of adding comparison check in GenericCheck class, add a new ComparisonCheck class where it will do the comparison between kind and match. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- None Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Configuration Impact -------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <abhishek-kekane> Other contributors: <None> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- - Add comparison check for 'kind' and 'match' in GenericCheck class Incubation ========== None Adoption -------- Glance Library ------- oslo-incubator Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- None Documentation Impact ==================== None Dependencies ============ https://review.openstack.org/97817/ References ========== https://review.openstack.org/98737/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

subject: Remove _sync_power_states conflict with deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-28 21:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6c84fa1578c48f19e8da9a0a18c8f8adb1558c9b', 'message': 'Remove _sync_power_states conflict with deploy

Currently _sync_power_states() sychronizes on the instance
uuid before checking if there is a pending task state. The
sychronizing is conflicting with deployment of the instance,
which could be a lengthy task and blocks all other periodic
tasks in doing so.  There is no need to synchronize before
the check because the data is already read and is not updated
within the synchronized method before the check.

Change-Id: I1371c6cdd01c146ae89791104ba12b5ae9f7f9a1
Closes-Bug: 1362194
'}]
commit_message:
Remove _sync_power_states conflict with deploy

Currently _sync_power_states() sychronizes on the instance
uuid before checking if there is a pending task state. The
sychronizing is conflicting with deployment of the instance,
which could be a lengthy task and blocks all other periodic
tasks in doing so.  There is no need to synchronize before
the check because the data is already read and is not updated
within the synchronized method before the check.

Change-Id: I1371c6cdd01c146ae89791104ba12b5ae9f7f9a1
Closes-Bug: 1362194
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/117634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Apic drivers enhancements (second approach): Backend

- Move backend facing modules to a library

Implements blueprint: apic-driver-enhancements

Change-Id: Ia4553d3885ca1886ca6bc7ea5d96afeace5fc457
