commit_message:
Centralize handling of /lost+found

Just remove globally /lost+found after the root and install phases, so
distribution elements don't need to do that by themselves.

Change-Id: Ic783e613bd8794aefd3f40c9a7c308d14cd04b8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/78/111678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
How to install Fuel on vSphere

ref-arch -- add 7000-vcenter- -- add info about
how Fuel is run under vSphere

planning-guide -- add 7300-fuel-on-vsphere-prepare
which needs some information about how to plan for this

user-guide -- add 7350-fuel-on-vsphere.rst with instructions
for preparing the vCenter for the Fuel installation
and installing Fuel on vSphere

Change-Id: Ib6cc7f55e716459ce41a7826074aa25406fd64e2

commit_message:
Initial connect orders resource to certificate processing

Connects the new orders type/meta API to the issue_certificate_request()
method of certificate worker tasking logic. The order plugin metadata is not
provided with this CR. Saving a certificate into a Container is also not
provided with this CR. This CR does address issues with the orders resource
processing.

Change-Id: Id5c6c06ecccd3d4d7eb27d974156dba06bd8fe6f
Implements: blueprint add-ssl-ca-support

commit_message:
Add a py3pep8 tox job. This will verify py3 compliant syntax

At this time barbican has several syntax errors that prevent this from
becoming a voting gate

Change-Id: I652f561264a7b389af23ee7b3569f893dfbc021e

commit_message:
Splits generic validation tests from model tests

There is no reason to run the generic tests for every model we are
testing. Also in doing the split I noticed that there were a couple of
places using the wrong schema.

Change-Id: I4c117fcce867ba7ccd51099614862c4827d8843b

commit_message:
Update API document with BootDevice

This patch adds description about above BootDevice Web APIs.
* GET v1/nodes/(node_uuid)/management/boot_device
* GET v1/nodes/(node_uuid)/management/boot_device/supported
* PUT v1/nodes/(node_uuid)/management/boot_device

Change-Id: I2826e59332102b258b72e9850baa1a6b0d189f79

Integration test scenarios

Added integration test scenarios.
Added mechanism for using alternative tenant.

added_lines: alt_tenant = False if (cls.config.compute.allow_tenant_isolation and cls.tenant_isolation): if cls.alt_tenant: creds = cls.isolated_creds.get_alt_creds() username, tenant_name, password = creds cls.os_alt = tempest.clients.Manager(username=username, password=password, tenant_name=tenant_name) if cls.alt_tenant: cls.os_alt = tempest.clients.AltManager() if cls.alt_tenant: cls.client_alt = cls.os_alt.magnetodb_client cls.streaming_client_alt = cls.os_alt.magnetodb_streaming_client def wait_for_table_active(cls, table_name, timeout=60, interval=3, alt=False): def check(): client = cls.client if not alt else cls.client_alt headers, body = client.describe_table(table_name) def wait_for_table_deleted(self, table_name, timeout=60, interval=3, alt=False): def check(): client = self.client if not alt else self.client_alt names = [d['href'] for d in client.list_tables()[1]['tables']] return table_name not in names def _check_exception(self, expected_exc, expected_message, method, *args, **kwargs): with self.assertRaises(expected_exc) as r_exc: method(*args, **kwargs) message = r_exc.exception._error_string self.assertIn(expected_message, message)
deleted_lines: if cls.config.compute.allow_tenant_isolation and cls.tenant_isolation: def wait_for_table_active(cls, table_name, timeout=60, interval=3): def check(): headers, body = cls.client.describe_table(table_name) def wait_for_table_deleted(self, table_name, timeout=120, interval=3): def check(): return table_name not in self.client.list_tables()['table_names']

subject: libvirt: Uses correct imagebackend for configdrive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-26 10:38:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2403c38940c30fc76137ddffd720671c2209dc8b', 'message': "libvirt: Uses correct imagebackend for configdrive

When the configdrive file is created it must be moved to the
configured imagebackend, not alwas the raw one.

Otherwise nova can't boot an instance with a configdrive attached
when the rbd backend is configured.

Related to bug #1246201

Change-Id: I59578d9b87a36ff4417a30ff14c5774c54698cf3
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-26 11:00:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f0c058ec18ab9767de254d3a63c73ec4324caa05', 'message': "libvirt: Uses correct imagebackend for configdrive

commit_message:
libvirt: Uses correct imagebackend for configdrive

When the configdrive file is created it must be moved to the
configured imagebackend, not always the raw one.

Otherwise nova can't boot an instance with a configdrive attached
when the rbd backend is configured.

Related to bug #1246201
Closes-bug: #1361840

Change-Id: I59578d9b87a36ff4417a30ff14c5774c54698cf3

commit_message:
Make RHSM registration set -u safe

There are a bunch of optional env vars references in the rhsm
registration script, but they weren't wrapped to be set -u safe so
they cause build failures if any aren't set.

Change-Id: I18326b618f0920efa4dbd805611c6ee66d33ebb0

commit_message:
Remove duplicated negative factors in keypair test

In test_keypair_create_fail_policy, there are two negative factors.
One is a policy violation, and another is a bad request body.
The purpose of the test is checking the policy violation, so a bad
request body is not right for this test.
This patch removes a bad request body from the test.

Change-Id: Ia165e08410b0576950efe83e5ab6a92c9c7f6a50

commit_message:
Change wget to curl for using both of them is redundant

heat-cfntools depends on wget and curl. It's redundant.
Since the curl is widely used, replace wget command to curl.

Change-Id: I691bdc046bd72a44c11f25e359c5036ae1a9e86b
Closes-Bug: 1359430

commit_message:
Preserve exception text during schedule retries

This fix preserves the exception text (as intended) when the number
of scheduling retries exceeds the maximum attempts.  We don't pop
the exception message anymore in _log_compute_error so that the
final "max attempts" error message has an opportunity to dump it
as well.

This defect caused the exception text (from the compute process) to
ALWAYS be None, thus making it difficult to triage compute errors.

Change-Id: I5c7cac1d79dc583cca523270bb0a96d3353ca1f6
Closes-Bug: #1361097

added_lines: import sixfrom nova import exception @mock.patch.object(scheduler_utils, '_max_attempts') def test_populate_retry_exception_at_max_attempts(self, _max_attempts): _max_attempts.return_value = 2 host_state = dict(host='fake-host', nodename='fake-node', limits='fake-limits') msg = 'The exception text was preserved!' filter_properties = dict(retry=dict(num_attempts=2, hosts=[], exc=exception.NovaException(msg))) scheduler_utils.populate_filter_properties(filter_properties, host_state) passed = False try: scheduler_utils.populate_retry(filter_properties, 'fake-uuid') except exception.NoValidHost as nvh: assert(six.text_type(nvh).find(msg) != -1) passed = True assert(passed)

commit_message:
Revert "Add workaround for reloading haproxy on Fedora"

The upstream fix to the haproxy package has been released,
so this should no longer be necessary.

This reverts commit e3d26159bd1746fa8d10f77cbab798735da8d333.

Change-Id: Ic62222731b34897b1b8dc2bc88049655585b04d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/03/115303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1126955 # The haproxy service file on Fedora is broken for reloads right now, so # replace it with a fixed version. Once the bug above is fixed we can # remove this workaround. if [ -f /lib/systemd/system/haproxy.service -a -f /usr/sbin/haproxy-systemd-wrapper ]; then cat > /lib/systemd/system/haproxy.service <<EOF [Unit] Description=HAProxy Load Balancer After=syslog.target network.target [Service] ExecStart=/usr/sbin/haproxy-systemd-wrapper -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg -p /run/haproxy.pid ExecReload=/bin/kill -USR2 \$MAINPID [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target EOF fi

commit_message:
default to MULTI_HOST

Given that we want multi host environments to be a supported thing
we should just default to multi host in the base case for devstack,
as it's one less knob to turn.

Change-Id: I41e6055c9bf2f56145308cb8c6317db85e1a8489
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/76/112276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Introducing 'workflow' as an individual entity

* Added Workflow DB model
* Removed 'workbook_name' parameter from Engine.start_workflow signature
* Fixed unit tests
* Fixed module trusts to create individual workbook entities when
 on workbook definition update
* Fixed API tests
* Switched v1 controllers to explicitly use DB API v1

Change-Id: I6a096e1c5d8082d3d1cdd47b575b85b28224d2a6

TODO(rakhmerov): It currently duplicates the method in ../v1/namespaces.py def merge_base_parameters(action, ns_base_parameters): if not ns_base_parameters: return if 'base-parameters' not in action: action['base-parameters'] = ns_base_parameters return action_base_parameters = action['base-parameters'] utils.merge_dicts(action_base_parameters, ns_base_parameters) class NamespaceSpec(base.BaseSpec): # See http://json-schema.org _schema = { "type": "object", "properties": { "Version": {"type": "string"}, "name": {"type": "string"}, "class": {"type": ["string", "null"]}, "base-parameters": {"type": ["object", "null"]}, "actions": {"type": "object"} }, "required": ["Version", "name", "actions"], "additionalProperties": False } _version = '2.0' def __init__(self, data): super(NamespaceSpec, self).__init__(data) self._name = data['name'] self._clazz = data.get('class') self._base_parameters = data.get('base-parameters') self._parameters = data.get('parameters') for _, action in data['actions'].iteritems(): action['namespace'] = self._name if 'class' not in action: action['class'] = self._clazz merge_base_parameters(action, self._base_parameters) self._actions = self._spec_property('actions', actions.ActionSpecList) def get_name(self): return self._name def get_class(self): return self._clazz def get_base_parameters(self): return self._base_parameters def get_parameters(self): return self._parameters def get_actions(self): return self._actions class NamespaceSpecList(base.BaseSpecList): item_class = NamespaceSpec _version = '2.0'

commit_message:
Renaming 'linear' workflow to 'direct'

* Linear workflow was not an accurate term for this workflow type
  and it will conflict with truly linear workflow that will appear
  later.

Change-Id: Ia9035d419bc720ce8397cf6f1493a968be948eeb

commit_message:
ping before we ssh

For a sanity check, we should actually figure out if we can get
to the host at all before we ssh to it. This hopefully gives us
information about the state of the world before we blame it
entirely on ssh.

To enable this new check the neutron scenario tests in:
test_security_groups_basic_ops had to be modified to add a sec group
rule to allow icmp traffic. Otherwise the tests would fail when they
attempt to ssh into guests, because the ping sanity check added would
fail before ssh is ever used.

Related-Bug: #1298472
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Treinish <mtreinish@kortar.org>
Change-Id: I9e7f9a76ac4c9edadce6c7ba11a6aaead6e4bbb7

commit_message:
remove H305 because it's python version specific

If you make the code pass when running it under python2 it will
fail under python3 because of builtins that migrated it. As the
python stdlib is not fixed, but grows over time, this is actually
a counter productive test as we try to get towards python3, and
python versions that change over time.

Change-Id: I7e4d83d9663d8e59cce3d3254e37672ef4222199

deleted_lines:
def hacking_import_groups(logical_line, blank_before, previous_logical, indent_level, previous_indent_level, physical_line, noqa): r"""Check that imports are grouped correctly. OpenStack HACKING guide recommendation for imports: imports grouped such that Python standard library imports are together, third party library imports are together, and project imports are together Okay: import os
import sys

import six

import hacking Okay: import six
import znon_existent_package Okay: import os
import threading H305: import hacking
import os H305: import os
import six H305: import os
import znon_existent_package """ if (noqa or blank_before > 0 or indent_level != previous_indent_level): return normalized_line = core.import_normalize(logical_line.strip()).split() normalized_previous = core.import_normalize(previous_logical. strip()).split() if normalized_line and normalized_line[0] == 'import': current_type = _get_import_type(normalized_line[1]) if normalized_previous and normalized_previous[0] == 'import': previous_type = _get_import_type(normalized_previous[1]) if current_type != previous_type: yield(0, 'H305: imports not grouped correctly ' '(%s: %s, %s: %s)' % (normalized_previous[1], previous_type, normalized_line[1], current_type)) @core.flake8ext

commit_message:
disable apparmor

apparmor error messages seem to be showing up in libvirt logs
regarding snapshots. It is possibly related to our snapshot issues.

We already disable selinux, disabling apparmor should be par for
the course.

Change-Id: I283d50766e3fa9db94484789037b3bbf7604902e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/102790/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # disable apparmor, which may be interacting poorly with libvirt if is_ubuntu; then sudo service apparmor stop || /bin/true sudo update-rc.d -f apparmor remove || /bin/true fi

commit_message:
json is stdlib, fix import in setup-neutron

The json module is provided by the standard library, fix the import
ordering in setup-neutron.

Change-Id: I22545dc1e5328eb11ef20afe38b6f0599fa60f41

commit_message:
Add support for interacting with swift

This commit introduces support for interacting with
swift for creating and deleting swift objects. This
will be initially used by ilo driver for hosting
temporary floppy images.

Change-Id: I9a3962820b7e18fb1014be1e43cb107facfede9f
Implements: blueprint ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/105795/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright 2014 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from six.moves.urllib import parse from oslo.config import cfg from swiftclient import client as swift_client from swiftclient import exceptions as swift_exceptions from swiftclient import utils as swift_utils from ironic.common import exception swift_opts = [ cfg.IntOpt('retries', default=2, help='Number of times to retry the request before failing ' 'for swift operations') ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(swift_opts, group='swift') class SwiftAPI(object): """API for communicating to swift API.""" def __init__(self, **kwargs): self.context = kwargs.get('context', None) params = {'retries': CONF.swift.retries, 'insecure': CONF.keystone_authtoken.insecure} params['user'] = kwargs.get('user', CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_user) params['tenant_name'] = kwargs.get('tenant_name', CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_tenant_name) params['key'] = kwargs.get('key', CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_password) auth_url = kwargs.get('authurl', CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri) auth_url = parse.urljoin(auth_url.rstrip('/'), 'v2.0') params['authurl'] = auth_url params['auth_version'] = kwargs.get('auth_version', 2) self.connection = swift_client.Connection(**params) def create_object(self, container, object_name, filename, **kwargs): """Uploads a given file to swift. :param token: The keystone token to use for authentication :param object_name: The name of the object in swift :param filename: The file to upload to as the object data :returns: The swift UUID of the object :raises: SwiftOperationError, if operation with swift fails. """ try: self.connection.head_container(container) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e: if not kwargs.get('create_container', True): msg = _("Error while getting info of container %s") % container raise exception.SwiftOperationError(msg=msg) try: self.connection.put_container(container) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e2: raise exception.SwiftOperationError(e2) fileobj = open(filename, "r") object_headers = kwargs.get('object_headers', {}) try: object_uuid = self.connection.put_object(container, object_name, fileobj, headers=object_headers ) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e: raise exception.SwiftOperationError(e) finally: fileobj.close() return object_uuid def get_tmp_url(self, container, object_name, timeout): """Returns the tmp url for the given swift object. :param container: The container in which swift object is placed. :param object: The name of the swift object. :param timeout: The timeout after which the generated url will expire. :returns: The tmp url for the object. """ try: storage_url, token = self.connection.get_auth() parse_result = parse.urlparse(storage_url) swift_object_path = '/'.join((parse_result.path, container, object_name)) account_info = self.connection.head_account() tmp_url_key = account_info['x-account-meta-temp-url-key'] url_path = swift_utils.generate_temp_url(swift_object_path, timeout, tmp_url_key, 'GET') return parse.urlunparse((parse_result.scheme, parse_result.netloc, url_path, None, None, None)) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e: raise exception.SwiftOperationError(e) def delete_object(self, container, object_name): """Deletes the given swift object. :param token: The keystone token to use for authentication :param object_name: The name of the object in swift :param container: The container in which swift object is placed. :returns: Nothing. :raises: SwiftOperationError, if operation with swift fails. """ try: self.connection.delete_object(container, object_name) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e: raise exception.SwiftOperationError(e)

commit_message:
Support for Python 3

Fix up various things to support Python 3. This also included removing
the pretty lines in README.rst, because tox with Python 3 just could
not cope.

Change-Id: I8e8a40ebc54ab781ccf0961a88fd1f8526aaeba0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-apply-config refs/changes/82/115882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if type(contents) == str: contents = contents.encode('utf-8') stdout, stderr = p.communicate(json.dumps(config).encode('utf-8')) return stdout.decode('utf-8')

commit_message:
Add improved SSH/Fuel web instructions

- List all the IP address on which Fuel UI is
  accessible instead of only eth0.
- Also added default username and password
  for Fuel UI, hardcoded as admin/admin
- Removes duplicate code from
  bootstrap_admin_node scripts which was
  previously causing the sed line to
  appear twice in /etc/rc.local

Closes-Bug: #1351937

Change-Id: Ib0605c298c6ef26e8cdceb07171b76cee96ae3f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/05/113605/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Fuel UI is available on: http://:8000Default Fuel UI login: admin Default Fuel UI password: admin cat >> "/etc/rc.local" << EOF # First delete previous fuel UI entries from /etc/issue sed -i '/http:\/\//d' /etc/issue # Append url for every interface with an IP address # This will show addres of eth9..0 in descending order for ip in `ip -0 -4 addr | grep "eth." | awk '/inet / {print $2 }' | cut -d/ -f1`; do sed -i "/available on:/a http:\/\/$ip:8000" /etc/issue done EOF
deleted_lines: Fuel UI is available on: http://:8000echo "sed -i \"s%\(^.*able on:\).*$%\1 http://\`ip address show eth0 | awk '/inet / {print \$2}' | cut -d/ -f1 -\`:8000%\" /etc/issue" >>/etc/rc.local

commit_message:
Shut down supervisor before starting it in foreground

Added shutdown for nailgun and ostf containers.

Change-Id: I7db970fed80cebcdfa3298eef94061709bae45b4
Partial-Bug: #117250

subject: Use --tmpdir with mktemp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 09:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['bin/dib-run-parts'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dib-utils/commit/5327bf9a087307cc622ab7096672db36d5ecd8b5', 'message': 'Use --tmpdir with mktemp

Pass --tmpdir to mktemp so the new temporary directory is placed
within $TMPDIR, or falling back to /tmp. This way dib-run-parts can
use whatever the temporary directory is, instead of using an hardcoded
/tmp.

Change-Id: I6b55e3c6c1fe22108ea555d3766e0323695bd96d
'}]
commit_message:
Use --tmpdir with mktemp

Pass --tmpdir to mktemp so the new temporary directory is placed
within $TMPDIR, or falling back to /tmp. This way dib-run-parts can
use whatever the temporary directory is, instead of using an hardcoded
/tmp.

Change-Id: I6b55e3c6c1fe22108ea555d3766e0323695bd96d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dib-utils refs/changes/27/109527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PROFILE_DIR=$(mktemp -d --tmpdir profiledir.XXXXXX)

commit_message:
Enable Python 3.4 enum in Neutron.

Define enum validation as part of the REST
validation framework
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100908/

Change-Id: Ica6990dae272254ad2cf7d078c8f9d5a18239b0e
Implements: blueprint using-python-enum
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/71/101171/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enum34

subject: Install fuelclient before containers on Fuel Master
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-28 13:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/examples/host-only.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/878839ea0e13ecbca40c55f96ce9270c802c20e7', 'message': 'Install fuelclient before containers on Fuel Master

Nailgun container needs /etc/fuel/client
configured because it mounts this path
read-only and errors during its puppet run.

Change-Id: I21d0d62d03821d1ccaf4b4bfabd2df8188120287
Closes-Bug: #1362614
'}]
commit_message:
Install fuelclient before containers on Fuel Master

Nailgun container needs /etc/fuel/client
configured because it mounts this path
read-only and errors during its puppet run.

Change-Id: I21d0d62d03821d1ccaf4b4bfabd2df8188120287
Closes-Bug: #1362614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/08/117508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Class['nailgun::client'] ->

commit_message:
Fix supervisord start with stale pidfile

supervisord has a stale pidfile sometimes
during Fuel container upgrades.
Also corrected whitespace issues.

Reduced wait time for processes to 5s so that
init script doesn't exceed its max timeout.

Change-Id: I6e5511f5fcce0205283594a290e72084b20e6aa7
Closes-Bug: #1361756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/50/117250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -e $PIDFILE ] && supervisor_status; then supervisor_status() { /usr/bin/supervisorctl status && kill -s 0 `cat /var/run/supervisord.pid` 2>/dev/null return $? } supervisor_status

subject: Allow table actions to be displayed in a menu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-30 15:20:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8ffdc745e1d2199ffb64d9c52e1d73728ea52626', 'message': "Allow table actions to be displayed in a menu

This adds the ability for table actions to be placed into an
actions menu above the table in addition to the current
button only format. This ability is not implemented in any
existing horizon table but is mainly meant for those who
build on horizon with tables that might have many actions.

To use a table actions menu, add a list of table action
names to the table Meta class using the table_actions_menu
attribute. For example, to display the Soft Reboot and
Terminate actions in a menu on the project instances table
add this attribute to the project instances table Meta class:

    table_actions_menu = ('soft_reboot', 'terminate',)

Implements: blueprint table-action-menus
Change-Id: I02cd52f06be3fa11dd5fe0b45c8cc1e3bff5efdb
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-07 16:19:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6791bfb4ccc90e36ce544be145ec90a1583e9ba1', 'message': "Allow table actions to be displayed in a menu

commit_message:
Allow table actions to be displayed in a menu

This adds the ability for table actions to be placed into an
actions menu above the table in addition to the current
button only format. This ability is not implemented in any
existing horizon table but is mainly meant for those who
build on horizon with tables that might have many actions.

To use a table actions menu, add a list of table action
classes to the table Meta class using the table_actions_menu
attribute. For example, to display the Soft Reboot and
Terminate actions in a menu on the project instances table
add this attribute to the project instances table Meta class:

    table_actions_menu = (SoftRebootInstance, TerminateInstance,)

Implements: blueprint table-action-menus
Change-Id: I02cd52f06be3fa11dd5fe0b45c8cc1e3bff5efdb

commit_message:
Fixes terminate_connection live migration issue

Reverts the changes to cinder/volume/manager.py added in
commit b868ae707f9ecbe254101e21d9d7ffa0b05b17d1 as calling
remove_export in terminate_connection causes Nova live
migration to fail when volumes are attached.

Change-Id: I38f3db336db22bb096a8855bcbbfeba16e517b80
Closes-Bug: #1361738

commit_message:
Fix concurrent policy issue in unittest

After merge of following commit: 4f17b8d837ebad4ef2e8ae5fe95ea968c7b8b587
appears unstable error when we get denial from policy check.
'Fix' mocks policy.check_policy method and tests that it was called.
We do not test policy actions in related unittest suite located in
'manila.tests.api.v1.test_share_networks' module, and should not.

Change-Id: I8885fa622e603c2e1882709d427e2fd1b532197c
Closes-Bug: #1362468

commit_message:
Fix flavor object can't delete extra_spec when deleted by del statement

The extra_spec can't be deleted by both v2 and v3 API. This is due to
when delete extra_spec's item by del statement, it won't trigger the
property setter, then flavor object won't know the extra_spec is changed.
This patch change flavor's save function to compare orignal extra_spec and
current extra_spec for getting it changed or not.

Change-Id: I82d21dbd4f8a9261c9263e3ccddead0144a758e5
Closes-Bug: #1362471

commit_message:
Repeat add-tenant and remove-tenant option in cli

For cisco-network-profile-create and cisco-network-profile-update cli,
add repeatable add-tenant and remove-tenant options so that user can
add and remove multiple tenants in a single cli request.

This fix includes changes in neutron, python-neutronclient and horizon.
All the changes should be merged at the same time

Implements: blueprint cisco-network-profile-multi-tenants-support
Change-Id: Ia902426b10d22a757ebbf62249dc28e9909dbff0

commit_message:
Add libxmlsec1 as external package dependency on OS X

This is required to use pysaml2.

There are several packages related to libxmlsec1 on Debian and Fedora,
and I'm not sure which is/are required without testing, so this patch is
limited to documenting the change required for OS X.

Implements bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

Change-Id: I61586a0b6d9411136f7e2d5a3f991bee4617f355
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/07/116907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ brew install python openssl gettext libxmlsec1

commit_message:
Fix the Neutron DB creation during deployment

Neutron database should be created by the Neutron db migration scripts,
but they are ignored during deployment of HA clusters. The problem is
the migration scripts depends on neutron-server package installation,
but it's installed as a dependency for the OVS server package, so no
necessary event was produced by Puppet. Now it's installed separately.

Change-Id: I5d10ff9df6a37ad807d0d0214f3a6113bd58c08c
Closes-bug: #1361541

commit_message:
Use monasca everywhere

Rename all uses of mon-persister to monasca-persister. For example,
the service is now called monasca-persister not mon-persister

Rename all packages from com.hpcloud.mon.persister to monasca.persister

Change-Id: Ic131b0eb0ac30e9ae91ca1f2f9df88fc9f837c98

commit_message:
Check vlan parameter is valid

Now, we can create network with invalid vlan with nova-network.
Check if vlan parameter is greater than 4094 or less than 1.

Change-Id: I27a74fb76ba575f43fee669c0c495e0ef96d4b18
Closes-Bug: #1334563

subject: Fix failed to delete the EIP resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-26 08:20:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/e6992449e2ffff939b2f617abc8549e2bbe838b2', 'message': "Fix failed to delete the EIP resource

Unable to delete a CREATE_FAILED stack which the AWS::EC2::EIP
resource create failed while association creation. So if the
association create failed, don't try to disassociate it.

Change-Id: I6a34398f27d6b21de9209de70bf8cc3c77d27149
Closes-Bug: #1334497
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-27 02:33:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/fd441dc13dc963f18f157d664141b709cff138ed', 'message': 'Fix failed to delete the EIP resource

Unable to delete a CREATE_FAILED stack which the AWS::EC2::EIP
resource create failed while association creation. So we attempt
to disassociate, if the UnprocessableEntity exception raised, we
ignore it.

Change-Id: I6a34398f27d6b21de9209de70bf8cc3c77d27149
Closes-Bug: #1334497
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-28 02:05:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/b79d95287ef9287ce906e131e87c2bc74762b14b', 'message': 'Fix failed to delete the EIP resource

resource create failed while association creation. So we attempt
to disassociate and to catch the exception, and to check if not
associate we just ignore it while deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1334497

commit_message:
Fix failed to delete the EIP resource

When AWS::EC2::EIP is failed to associate with
the server, it can't be delete. So we attempt
to disassociate and to catch the exception, and to
check if not associate we just ignore it while deletion.

Change-Id: I6a34398f27d6b21de9209de70bf8cc3c77d27149
Closes-Bug: #1334497

commit_message:
Update stack.load_all adding show_nested

Add a show_nested argument, defaulted to false, which will
show nested stacks, not just top-level ones.  Due to an
unfortunate collision in the way backup and nested stacks
are currently stored (both are identifiable by having an
owner_id), we have to filter the backup stack by name, if
it exists.  In a future patch this can be cleaned up by
modifying the DB schema to store data to more explicitly
specify backup stacks.

blueprint: list-nested
Change-Id: I1b2e44380cf2f9162dbc4d9bc300e15c325f0eca

commit_message:
Adds console script entry point

A Swift client executable needs to be provided on Windows since Python scripts
cannot be executed directly.

This approach is also consistent with other OpenStack Python clients (e.g.
Nova, Neutron, Cinder, etc.).

Change-Id: I7f03b7c305dceed4fa6f4fe1c1281659820606e4
Closes-Bug: #1359360
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/82/115782/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [entry_points] console_scripts = swift = swiftclient.shell:main

commit_message:
handle_signal to handle translated error msgs

Heat software config deployments, when they fail, in some
circumstances pass translateable Messages as their error output.

Patch converts messages to unicode rather than str.

Change-Id: Idd325c80b68a69d11cea306bd6980518f0948196
Closes-Bug: #1332355

commit_message:
Improve errors in Volume tasks

Produce more meaningful errors and warnings
when attachment/detachment/extension of the volume fails
due to wrong final volume status.

Change-Id: Icc04ecff9cc3a53585926d408f1f986212ff09b1

commit_message:
Add more info to ResourceUnknownStatus

Added an optional field 'result' to ResourceUnknownStatus exception
message describing the problem happend due to the said status
(defaults to 'Resource failed'). Also modified tests accordingly.

Change-Id: Id299aec598ea44cdb7d9fca5f8f580a177fef059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/117242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg_fmt = _('%(result)s - Unknown status %(resource_status)s') def __init__(self, result=_('Resource failed'), **kwargs): super(ResourceUnknownStatus, self).__init__(result=result, **kwargs)

commit_message:
filter: add per-aggregate filter to configure disk_allocation_ratio

Adds a filter AggregateDiskFilter which provides the ability to
read from aggregates metadata the "disk_allocation_ratio".

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint per-aggregate-disk-allocation-ratio
Change-Id: I79d59fcdfb09e67ed6f12113615c673624b24a19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/65452/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * |DiskFilter| - filters hosts by their disk allocation. Only hosts with sufficient disk space to host the instance are passed. * |AggregateDiskFilter| - filters hosts by disk allocation with per-aggregate ``disk_allocation_ratio`` setting. If no per-aggregate value is found, it will fall back to the global default ``disk_allocation_ratio``. If more than one value is found for a host (meaning the host is in two differenet aggregate with different ratio settings), the minimum value will be used... |DiskFilter| replace:: :class:`DiskFilter <nova.scheduler.filters.disk_filter.DiskFilter>` .. |AggregateDiskFilter| replace:: :class:`AggregateDiskFilter <nova.scheduler.filters.disk_filter.AggregateDiskFilter>`

commit_message:
Configure haproxy keystone backend before keystone service

Configure haproxy keystone backend before keystone service
starts. This will fix ordering problem when we have keystone
resources created before keystone is available. Service
is already started before resources creation, so that
puppet provider will receive a couple of 503|504 HTTP
errors in the worst case and handle them.

Closes-bug: #1357386

Change-Id: I906fb01f678b0407e421a5db7f617901fed80f79

commit_message:
Use the template module to access the Template class

i.e. stop using parser.Template
this imports the template module as "templatem" to avoid
namespace clashes with the many local variables called "template".

Change-Id: I97cc893f630e46589ee71fc73c6bbbcaa86b3a62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/91/107291/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine import template as templatem template = templatem.Template({ template = templatem.Template({ tmpl = templatem.Template(t)
deleted_lines: template = parser.Template({ template = parser.Template({ tmpl = parser.Template(t)

commit_message:
Allow for setting ViP ID

Allows the user to specify the id of an existing
virtual ip rather than create a new one. This
allows devices listening on different ports using
the same ip addresses.

Change-Id: Ieba48abc0470cc5b596245efa51e9919ef37e0ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/10/115710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Split scaling policy into separate files

A further step to split the AWS and the OS version of auto-scaling group
related classes.  This patch splits the scaling policy and launch
configuration into separate files.

This patch is not breaking any existing test cases. But more test cases
will be needed for the OS version scaling policy.

Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code
Change-Id: I0f888496d92b0efb5d63b567864488ff8a45e4ac

commit_message:
Cut down on warning logs

- don't log on ignore_not_found()
- drop some logs from warn to info
- remove the "no resources in template" log
- remove the "Duplicating event" log

Change-Id: Ie4d68b43607336c8c054a32126d6a05ba4e5e15c
Closes-bug: #1346755

commit_message:
Standardize AccessInfo token setting

When settings tokens via the factory v2 and v3 work completely
differently. This is somewhat expected due to tokens working differently
but it makes it hard to work with.

For example, if i have a v3 token but not the requests.Response that
created it there is no way for me to set the token data on the
AccessInfo object via factory.

Also in the case of V2 CMS tokens the value at ['token']['id'] is a fake
so that the signing process will work.

Allow overriding the token value from the factory and force setting the
token id on the AccessInfo in a standard way.

Change-Id: I856096dc5fae2ab0d1bedbac3294dc4976c3f3ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/15/113415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def factory(cls, resp=None, body=None, region_name=None, auth_token=None, **kwargs): auth_ref = None if resp and not auth_token: auth_token = resp.headers['X-Subject-Token'] auth_ref = AccessInfoV3(auth_token, **body['token']) else: auth_ref = AccessInfoV3(auth_token, **kwargs) # NOTE(jamielennox): already installed auth_token don't need # to do it again below so reset to None. auth_token = None auth_ref = AccessInfoV2(**body['access']) else: auth_ref = AccessInfoV2(**kwargs) auth_ref = AccessInfoV2(**kwargs) if auth_token: auth_ref.auth_token = auth_token return auth_ref return self['auth_token'] @auth_token.setter def auth_token(self, value): self['auth_token'] = value @auth_token.deleter def auth_token(self): try: del self['auth_token'] except KeyError: pass @AccessInfo.auth_token.getter def auth_token(self): try: return super(AccessInfoV2, self).auth_token except KeyError: return self['token']['id'] self.auth_token = token
deleted_lines: def factory(cls, resp=None, body=None, region_name=None, **kwargs): token = None if resp: token = resp.headers['X-Subject-Token'] return AccessInfoV3(token, **body['token']) else: return AccessInfoV3(token, **kwargs) return AccessInfoV2(**body['access']) else: return AccessInfoV2(**kwargs) return AccessInfoV2(**kwargs) raise NotImplementedError() @property def auth_token(self): return self['token']['id'] self.update(auth_token=token) def auth_token(self): return self['auth_token'] @property

commit_message:
Allow to decide between Nova-network and Neutron

Adds a heat.conf option to set the OpenStack component responsible for
networking, and makes heat-engine auto-discover the networking service
on start up if such option is not set.
Also adds a convenience method to Resource class to let resources decide
what networking service to use.

Implements blueprint discover-networking-service

Change-Id: If7121089068cc2d2774bedb73e4e252b520eb5b3

commit_message:
tests for Keystone endpoint V2 API

This patch adds the JSON/XML clients and tests for following
Keystone endpoint V2 APIs :
1. endpoint-create
2. endpoint-delete
3. endpoint-list

Change-Id: Ie563fd08e2581f3220beedd8fe7e3426b3dc5bc7

commit_message:
Remove assignment_api dependency on token_api

The assignment_api now uses the callback system to avoid needing
to directly call token_api for invalidating the tokens in the
token persistence system.

This change is in support of non-persistent tokens which has a
dependency on unifying interactions with the token persistence
system.

Change-Id: I66af0a7281cf9a4d451f0f6d86da8182e2cc0e60
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Port os-server-groups extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 os-server-groups extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods
- Adds api sample tests

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I52e49e6e85a7516e3b184601374e5c987f60a9a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/115532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
boolean parameter type is not recognized in the API

The boolean type that was added to Heat templates is not recognized
in the API layer. Because of this, the API passes the schema type
(which is lowercase 'boolean') directly to the client, while all
other recognized types are passed with camel case.

Change-Id: I0d31401456c0f5cd0bb81e29323e40b4de66f331
Closes-Bug: 1361448

commit_message:
Upgrades, run iptables cleaning only for required containers

I doesn't make sence to run iptables
cleaning, for containers, which
doesn't have port bindings, e.g.
volume containers.

Change-Id: I7c313e5bb2806cbf4beb067ace6c4dc614a73281
Closes-bug: #1362544

commit_message:
Revert "cron job to clean up rabbitmq connections"

Should be merged after oslo.messaging fix is ready

This reverts commit 211de91ab89b57dfda6a8d0a518ed16abd156ad5.

Related-Bug: #856764

login, password, vhost)) break except Exception as e: traceback.print_exc(e, file=sys.stdout) print kill_connections(suspected_connections, vhost) if __name__ == "__main__": if 2 < len(sys.argv) > 3: commit_message:
Install latest iptables on the master node

When we run upgrade, during puppet run
it should install latest iptables from
the repository.

Change-Id: I9f0175ea2e35a6c1118804c7826d71f5a818a567
Closes-bug: #1359096

this information for horizon as well.

Nova object class.

commit_message:
Add a Set and SetOfIntegers object fields

Object fields that represent sets of things. Will be useful for NUMA
topology object which will be added in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I66d61c760a70ad661dff4c40c6933df06192ee8f
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/116361/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Set(CompoundFieldType): def coerce(self, obj, attr, value): if not isinstance(value, set): raise ValueError(_('A set is required here')) coerced = set() for element in value: coerced.add(self._element_type.coerce( obj, '%s["%s"]' % (attr, element), element)) return coerced def to_primitive(self, obj, attr, value): return set( [self._element_type.to_primitive(obj, attr, x) for x in value]) def from_primitive(self, obj, attr, value): return set([self._element_type.from_primitive(obj, attr, x) for x in value]) def stringify(self, value): return 'set([%s])' % ( ','.join([self._element_type.stringify(x) for x in value])) class SetOfIntegersField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = Set(Integer())

commit_message:
Ensure proper ordering of XML arguments

Random hash ordering can cause the 'encoding' argument to be rendered
in the XML string before the 'version' argument, resulting in XML
deserialization errors on the Keystone side.  This modifies
Document's string rendering to not rely on dict ordering when
constructing the header tag's version + encoding arguments and avoids
XML auth issues when using PYTHONHASHSEED=random.

Change-Id: I66d18a2f8da1088ec5d310a43c84df7e4d6a6f6b

This commit adds a file to outline what to look for as a tempest code
reviewer.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/99451/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Reviewing Tempest Code ====================== To start read the `OpenStack Common Review Checklist <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReviewChecklist#Common_Review_Checklist>`_ Ensuring code is executed ------------------------- For any new or change to a test it has to be verified in the gate. This means that the first thing to check with any change is that a gate job actually runs it. Tests which aren't executed either because of configuration or skips should not be accepted. Unit Tests ---------- For any change that adds new functionality to either common functionality or an out-of-band tool unit tests are required. This is to ensure we don't introduce future regressions and to test conditions which we may not hit in the gate runs. Tests, and service clients aren't required to have unit tests since they should be self verifying by running them in the gate. API Stability ------------- Tests that are being added for APIs which don't conform to the API stability guidelines should not be approved. When to approve --------------- * Every patch needs two +2s before being approved. * Its ok to hold off on an approval until a subject matter expert reviews it * If a patch has already been approved but requires a trivial rebase to merge, you do not have to wait for a second +2, since the patch has already had two +2s.

commit_message:
Correclty detected osd when the journal is a file

When the journal of the osd is set to a file instead of a partition,
ceph-disk list report a normal filesystem like this:

 /dev/sda2 other, xfs, mounted on /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5

So we must check that /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-5/journal point to
the journal passed to the osd class.

This patch ensure that.

Change-Id: I30ce854337d41029f3863e4cffef76685b8dcc0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/24/115924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ls -l /var/lib/ceph/osd/${cluster_name}-* | grep ' ${data}' || [ -n '${journal}' ] && ls -l /var/lib/ceph/osd/${cluster_name}-*/journal | grep ' ${journal}'if [ -z \"\$id\" -a -n \"${journal}\" ] ; then id=\$(ls -ld /var/lib/ceph/osd/${cluster_name}-*/journal | grep ' ${journal}' | sed -ne 's:.*/${cluster_name}-\\([0-9][0-9]*\\)/journal -> .*:\\1:p' || true) fi if test -f ${journal} ; then rm -f ${journal} fi

commit_message:
Add cm_api to global requirements

cm_api is needed for this blueprint:
Plugin for CDH with Cloudera Manager
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/cdh-plugin

This library will be used by Sahara for provisioning clusters
with Cloudera Hadoop distribution

Licensed by Apache-2.0
This library not compatible with Python 3
Ubuntu and Fedora don't provide packages with cm_api

Partially implement: blueprint cdh-plugin

Change-Id: I638d04d8bcece055e655b4243ad9c0f8d9dd8a70

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Ib3c6c3dd836255ee2435e3045404a0b3b0b4c534

commit_message:
bashate known as bash8 should be installed from pypi mirror.

bashate is available on pypi mirror,
We can install it from there and use it in run_tests.sh
file. So, bash8.py file is removed from devstack.

Change-Id: Ibf25e2e51a582114aad3c63cea2579f14b29d350
Closes-Bug: #1320535
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/79/107079/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install bash8 pip_install -U bash8

commit_message:
labs: fix ovs-vsctl error

By the time we try to create the internal bridge on compute and network
nodes, they have already been created, resulting in an error message.

This patch informs ovs-vsctl that the bridge may already exist.

Change-Id: Ib1b951f639d208b98769f28a66d0edff27ae6224
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/56/117456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo ovs-vsctl --may-exist add-br br-int

commit_message:
Install glance.store from git instead of pypi

In order to use python packages, we need to have all packages in a
namespace installed using the same method - either develop or install.
Therefore, we need to override the pip installed glance.store package
with one installed from the git repo.

Change-Id: Ieb4683800076b1bd64f839b077d12ec7e8e1539b

commit_message:
document VMDK driver support for Cinder block storage

- mention that starting with Fuel 5.1 we support VMDK driver for Cinder
- explicitly state that user has to change Cinder backend after
  finishing environment creation with vCenter as hypervisor option
- update screenshot where user selects storage backends for Cinder and
  Glance, right now there is no choice available, becase currently Ceph
  cannot be used with vCenter
- add screenshot showing where user can change Cinder storage backend
- correct Cinder definition in Terminology reference, that *VMDK*
  driver enables vCenter datastores support, not *vCenter* driver
- remove limitation in Planning guide that tells that VMDK driver is not
  supported, which is not true anymore
- add limitation in Planning guide that the only supported backend for
  Cinder is VMDK driver

Implements: blueprint vcenter-documentation-update-fuel-5.1
Change-Id: Idc2412f2d897d76e68c968bb77b84e350af07cd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/01/112601/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: you should left default option for Cinder which is LVM over iSCSI. Starting from Fuel 5.1 you must use VMDK driver as Cinder storage backend.After completing environment creation process you must enable the VMDK driver for Cinder on Settings tab. .. image:: /_images/user_screen_shots/cinder-vmdk-backend.png :width: 50%
deleted_lines: you should select the LVM over iSCSI option.- If you are using the Multi-node HA mode, Swift is used as a backend for Cinder and is automatically installed on the Controller nodes.

commit_message:
Add recognition of 'INSERT IF NOT EXISTS'

Analyses expected_condition_map in put_item requests
whether 'INSERT IF NOT EXISTS' behavior is expected
and handles it properly

Fixes bug: 1360131

Change-Id: I02cc32325fb224fa7ce9e810be6b94f1dd9219c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnetodb refs/changes/37/116937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @attr(type=['PI-undef', 'negative']) def test_put_item_if_not_exists_negative(self): self.table_name = rand_name().replace('-', '') self._create_test_table( [{'attribute_name': 'message', 'attribute_type': 'S'}], self.table_name, [{'attribute_name': 'message', 'key_type': 'HASH'}], wait_for_active=True) item = { "message": {"S": 'message_text'}, "author": {"S": "Bob"}, } new_item = { "message": {"S": "message_text"}, "author": {"S": "Alice"}, } expected = { "message": { "exists": False } } put_resp = self.client.put_item(self.table_name, item) self.assertEqual(put_resp[1], {}) with self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest) as raises_cm: self.client.put_item(self.table_name, new_item, expected) exception = raises_cm.exception self.assertIn("ConditionalCheckFailedException", str(exception)) get_resp = self.client.get_item(self.table_name, {"message": {"S": 'message_text'}}, consistent_read=True) self.assertEqual(get_resp[1]['item']['author'], {'S': 'Bob'}) @attr(type='PI-undef2') def test_put_item_if_not_exists(self): self.table_name = rand_name().replace('-', '') self._create_test_table( [{'attribute_name': 'message', 'attribute_type': 'S'}], self.table_name, [{'attribute_name': 'message', 'key_type': 'HASH'}], wait_for_active=True) item = { "message": {"S": 'message_text'}, "author": {"S": "Bob"}, } expected = { "message": { "exists": False } } put_resp = self.client.put_item(self.table_name, item, expected) self.assertEqual(put_resp[1], {}) get_resp = self.client.get_item(self.table_name, {"message": {"S": 'message_text'}}, consistent_read=True) self.assertEqual(get_resp[1]['item']['author'], {'S': 'Bob'})

commit_message:
Put upgrade tarball in lrzip archive

New build target: upgrade-lrzip

Command line for extract:
lrzuntar fuel-master-upgrade.tar.lrz

Change-Id: Ie23263cc3bdc27acdee5ba6858f1ee282d414277
Closes-Bug: #1356813
Blueprint: upgrade-lrzip

Allow admin and public workers to be configured

* Add 2 new attributes for admin_workers and public_workers
* Add specs

commit_message:
Update Testing.md to factor out Strainer

* remove refs to Strainer
* add steps for testing
* remove knife test as it's not used in gates anymore
* remove test bash script

Partial-Bug: #1350470

commit_message:
Add two more tests which check workflow execution

- added test that check execution of mixed workflow (Mistral v1)
- added test that check execution of direct workflow where all keywords are used
(on-error, on-success, on-finish)

Implements blueprint: mistral-workflow-execution-tests

Change-Id: I3055d0084a8f8a69bd8ac5cd51e7c5e7ce049b63

commit_message:
Next version of stable/icehouse is 2014.1.1.

pbr pre-versioning causes current sdist of stable/icehouse to have
versions leading up to 2013.2, but that is already released - we
should be leading up to 2014.1.1 in this repository.

Change-Id: If4140a5a439a5ee93566e95c0cecd30ed7eeeea5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/59/115459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version = 2014.1.1

commit_message:
Sync models with migrations.

We are using declarative_base in nova.db.models just for reflection,
not for db creation. For creation we are using migrations. Actual state
of models is not the same as the database state.

The goal of proposed bp is to sync models with migrations, fix mistakes
and add testing of migrations and db models on real backends.

bp db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I2545f93618e315547e7bbc346f7ac4aee8134ff9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/25/85325/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================================== Models should be the same as the state in DB after migration (partial) ====================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-sync-models-with-migrations We are using declarative_base in nova.db.models just for reflection, not for db creation. For creation we are using migrations. Actual state of models is not the same as the database state. Problem description =================== Db models don't reflect actual state of database correctly. We don't have any tests that checks, that our models are up-to-date. Also we are testing it only on sqlite, which couldn't test such things as nullable constraints. Proposed change =============== 1. Use always explicit nullable parameter for columns. There is a lot of mistakes in current heat models implementation. (sometimes in schema is nullable=True and in model nullable=False and vise versa). Also at this moment when you see Column description without nullable, you couldn't be sure that is author forget to set nullable='False' or it is really nullable='True'. So the easiest way to track all this and to fix and to avoid such things is to have one rule "always use explicit nullable". 2. Add in __table_args__ indexes and unique constraints 3. Fix all mistakes in models 4. Fix all mistakes in migrations 5. Sync effects of migrations in different backends. 6. Add tests that ensures that models are up-to-date. This will allow us to find probably some mistake, or missing indexes and make work with db more clean. ==== The most part of this blueprint is implemented by now. But we still need to add tests to check models and migrations on real backends - mysql and postgresql, and to fix some mistakes in migrations and models which can be found. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- The most part of this blueprint, which could have a strong impact on data model, is implemented by this time. But anyway some changes which affect data model can be required if we find some mistakes. As we want db state to correspond with model, we have to: * fix mistakes with nullable parameter for column (we need a migratian for this); * add missing indexes to __table_args__ . REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Some impact is possible if we will change value of the nullable parameter for columns in some tables. Performance Impact ------------------ Needed migrations would have little performance impact because the tables it touches are generally very small. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: boris-42 Work Items ---------- * Add in __table_args__ indexes and unique constraints * Fix all mistakes in models * Fix all mistakes in migrations * Sync effects of migrations in different backends. * Add tests that ensures that models are up-to-date. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= We will add unit testing of our changes on real backends - mysql and postgresql, to ensure models correspond with migrations in all dialects. Moreover, we already have functional testing of db migrations. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Similar blueprints in other OpenStack projects: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack/?searchtext=db-sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Fix check-sanity + save-state /w disabled services

This adds a mapping for all process names described in BASE_SERVICES
and TARGET_SERVICES, allowing check-sanity to skip checking for running
processes of services that are disabled according to ENABLED_SERVICES.
It also updates grenade.sh and save-state to only dump databases that
exist.  These changes allow grenade to pass against deployments that
have disabled non-essential services in devstack.

Change-Id: Ic4b2bab88b12f33f939b9bf7aca47e930d799f3f
Closes-bug: #1355499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/05/113405/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/localrc # For a given process name, resolve the corresponding devstack service # name as it would appear in ENABLED_SERVICES. function process_to_service { case "$1" in "nova-api") echo "n-api" ;; "nova-conductor") echo "n-cond" ;; "nova-compute") echo "n-cpu" ;; "keystone") echo "key" ;; "glance-api") echo "g-api" ;; "cinder-api") echo "c-api" ;; "swift-object-server") echo "s-obj" ;; "swift-proxy-server") echo "s-proxy" ;; *) echo "$1" ;; esac } RUNNING="" for proc_name in ${TARGET_SERVICES}; do if is_service_enabled "$(process_to_service $proc_name)" ; then if ! is_running ${proc_name}; then NOT_RUNNING="$NOT_RUNNING $proc_name" else RUNNING="$RUNNING $proc_name" fi echo "the following services are running: $RUNNING"
deleted_lines: for name in ${TARGET_SERVICES}; do if ! is_running ${name}; then NOT_RUNNING="$NOT_RUNNING $name" echo "the following services are running: $TARGET_SERVICES"

commit_message:
Adding cornercases for set_metadata

Aggregate_set_metadata leaves users confused because it currently
does not check for duplicate key=value parameters for addition
or a missing key for deletion. All that user sees is that "metadata has been updated"
more details in bug1292572

This patch checks for above mentioned corner cases and informs users when and why
there was no change made in above corner cases

Adding better testcases also.

   Closes-Bug: #1292572

Change-Id: I820d793ac44680295df8b2a3f58a0834f7019875
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/85/98185/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Update the metadata associated with the aggregate.""" currentmetadata = getattr(aggregate, 'metadata', {}) if (len(set(metadata.items()) & set(currentmetadata.items()))) > 0: raise exceptions.CommandError("metadata already exists") userkeys = metadata.keys() if len(userkeys) > 0: userkey = userkeys[0] if not metadata[userkey] and not userkey in currentmetadata: raise exceptions.CommandError("metadata key %s does not exist" " hence can not be deleted" % userkey)
deleted_lines: """Update the metadata associated with the aggregate."""

commit_message:
Add basic WBE validation sanity tests

Add some basic tests that verify that our
new message format validation is working as
expected.

Part of blueprint wbe-message-validation

Change-Id: I64821407e52977a0e0ae0dff09f4b440717290cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/16/104016/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from taskflow import exceptions as excp from taskflow.openstack.common import uuidutilsclass TestProtocolValidation(test.TestCase): def test_send_notify(self): msg = pr.Notify() pr.Notify.validate(msg.to_dict(), False) def test_send_notify_invalid(self): msg = { 'all your base': 'are belong to us', } self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Notify.validate, msg, False) def test_reply_notify(self): msg = pr.Notify(topic="bob", tasks=['a', 'b', 'c']) pr.Notify.validate(msg.to_dict(), True) def test_reply_notify_invalid(self): msg = { 'topic': {}, 'tasks': 'not yours', } self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Notify.validate, msg, True) def test_request(self): msg = pr.Request(utils.DummyTask("hi"), uuidutils.generate_uuid(), pr.EXECUTE, {}, None, 1.0) pr.Request.validate(msg.to_dict()) def test_request_invalid(self): msg = { 'task_name': 1, 'task_cls': False, 'arguments': [], } self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Request.validate, msg) def test_request_invalid_action(self): msg = pr.Request(utils.DummyTask("hi"), uuidutils.generate_uuid(), pr.EXECUTE, {}, None, 1.0) msg = msg.to_dict() msg['action'] = 'NOTHING' self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Request.validate, msg) def test_response_progress(self): msg = pr.Response(pr.PROGRESS, progress=0.5, event_data={}) pr.Response.validate(msg.to_dict()) def test_response_completion(self): msg = pr.Response(pr.SUCCESS, result=1) pr.Response.validate(msg.to_dict()) def test_response_mixed_invalid(self): msg = pr.Response(pr.PROGRESS, progress=0.5, event_data={}, result=1) self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Response.validate, msg) def test_response_bad_state(self): msg = pr.Response('STUFF') self.assertRaises(excp.InvalidFormat, pr.Response.validate, msg)

commit_message:
Source all devstack service libs for Tempest

Devstack's tempest library relies on TEMPEST_SERVICES when
configuring the service_available section of tempest.conf. This
is built as various service libraries are sourced into the environment.
This imports all relevant devstack service libraries to ensure the
services_available section of tempest.conf is accurate.

Change-Id: Iea9c08f5ce374c4343ae56adb49221737c7a55d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/87/114087/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add within-juno dir and within-master symlink

This adds logic to upgrade_project() to call project upgrade
scripts from the within-$release directory if performing a
sideways upgrade within the same release.  A symlink named
within-master is added and linked to the current development
release to allow sideways migration testing of trunk.  When Juno
tags are cut and K opens, a from-kilo directoy should be created
and this symlink updated.

Change-Id: I770075442d05f38515e5dadf24f2c642d14d7845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/31/112731/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================================== Juno specific upgrade scripts =========================================== This directory can house individual service scripts for upgrading either from icehouse to juno or sideways migrating within juno. To do this add ``upgrade-$servicename`` script to this directory and include a ``configure_$servicename_upgrade`` function in the file. All services that don't have a specific upgrade script will just use the generic one, which performs a db-sync and installs the updated code.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-26 06:56:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/71349ca07a760804674ef0e60280508a4c520a69', 'message': "Set the python hash seed that tox uses to 0

The current trove unit tests don't work correctly with the random
hash seed that the new tox sets by default.

This change forces the new tox to use 0 as the hash seed which
should unblock the gate until we can fix the trove unit tests
to run correctly with a random hash seed.

This change will probably need to be backported to the stable

(cherry picked from commit 7e6cf5bfaf57ef8628c8f72ea29ecd12179fab72)

commit_message:
Set the python hash seed that tox uses to 0

The current trove unit tests don't work correctly with the random
hash seed that the new tox sets by default.

This change forces the new tox to use 0 as the hash seed which
should unblock the gate until we can fix the trove unit tests
to run correctly with a random hash seed.

This change will probably need to be backported to the stable
branches to ensure that the tox tests keep working there as well.

Change-Id: Ib5c6d4d166c847ce94ec70740c5753d338687865
(cherry picked from commit 7e6cf5bfaf57ef8628c8f72ea29ecd12179fab72)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/08/116808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note the hash seed is set to 0 until trove unit tests can run with # a random hash seed successfully. PYTHONHASHSEED=0 python setup.py testr --slowest

commit_message:
Catch BadRequest exception from correct module

Catch the correct BadRequest exception from the neutron
client module so deployments that don't support overlapping
IP addresses can be tested.

Change-Id: Ica58ffbff6cedd362e2b2b807438ec61bddf2f25
Closes-Bug: #1359508

commit_message:
Ensure assertion matches dict iter order in test

Fixes a test_linux_ip_lib test that made an assertion
on a command that was called that could fail depending
on the order of the dictionary when it was iterated over.

This patch makes the assertion match the order that the
command is constructed by iterating through the dictionary
as well.

Partial-Bug: #1348818
Change-Id: I7baa518169c193f7e98d38632e1db16eb57ffee7

commit_message:
Add support for provider-network extension in nuage Plugin

This implements support for creating provider networks
with Nuage plugin.

Implements: blueprint providernet-ext-support-for-nuage-plugin
Change-Id: Ibabc1561fc7b6bd5ea38617f145af1d0d4545a4f

added_lines: from neutron import contextfrom neutron.extensions import providernet as pnet class TestNuageProviderNetTestCase(NuagePluginV2TestCase): def test_create_provider_network(self): data = {'network': {'name': 'pnet1', 'tenant_id': 'admin', pnet.NETWORK_TYPE: 'vlan', pnet.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: ( 'b3b8648f-2c48-4006-a94d-4653e0a9c6e1'), pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID: 123}} network_req = self.new_create_request('networks', data, self.fmt) net = self.deserialize(self.fmt, network_req.get_response(self.api)) self.assertEqual(net['network'][pnet.NETWORK_TYPE], 'vlan') self.assertEqual(net['network'][pnet.PHYSICAL_NETWORK], 'b3b8648f-2c48-4006-a94d-4653e0a9c6e1') self.assertEqual(123, net['network'][pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID]) def test_create_provider_network_no_admin(self): data = {'network': {'name': 'pnet1', 'tenant_id': 'no_admin', pnet.NETWORK_TYPE: 'vlan', pnet.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: ( 'b3b8648f-2c48-4006-a94d-4653e0a9c6e1'), pnet.SEGMENTATION_ID: 123}} network_req = self.new_create_request('networks', data, self.fmt) network_req.environ['neutron.context'] = context.Context( '', 'no_admin', is_admin=False) res = network_req.get_response(self.api) self.assertEqual(exc.HTTPForbidden.code, res.status_int)

commit_message:
Clear entries in Cisco N1KV specific tables on rollback

During rollback operations, resources are cleaned up from neutron
database but leaves a few stale entries in the n1kv specific tables.
This change addresses the proper clean up of tables. i.e. VLAN/VXLAN
allocation tables, profile binding and vm network table.

Conflicts:

        neutron/plugins/cisco/n1kv/n1kv_neutron_plugin.py

Change-Id: I7a09d34f3a9dee0a43b76c5d781ee9eb9938953a
Closes-bug: #1336596
(cherry picked from commit 73b4239fbef5e52494cf3ffc3293dbb79b52d91c)

Handle more legacy version numbers

We were not handling 1.2.1a1 or 2.1.0.rc1.

Add check that fixed network cidr is
default value on slave

- Add check for fixed network cidr to simple flat test
- Add check for internal network cidr to neutron tests

subject: Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-14 18:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/mysql.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat/commit/0c77c940426fc5bfedaefa1b4625ad3e6ec85841', 'message': "Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.

When using version >= 2.2 of the MySQL module, setting up the database
for Keystone depended on the MySQL service (Service['mysqld']). However,
if the service is not managed by Puppet (e.g. it is managed through
Pacemaker instead), this would cause catalog compilation to fail because
there is no Service['mysqld']. This is the case when the MySQL module is
called with service_manage => false. Requiring Class['mysql::server']
instead fixes this.

Change-Id: I4ba7932d679764576a46ea599499991a5c57fc56
Closes-Bug: 1349316
(cherry picked from commit 5837aaeaadb14fdc089b25e666cfd8d91f0f53a6)
"}]
commit_message:
Require Class['mysql::server'], not Service['mysqld'] when creating DB.

When using version >= 2.2 of the MySQL module, setting up the database
for Keystone depended on the MySQL service (Service['mysqld']). However,
if the service is not managed by Puppet (e.g. it is managed through
Pacemaker instead), this would cause catalog compilation to fail because
there is no Service['mysqld']. This is the case when the MySQL module is
called with service_manage => false. Requiring Class['mysql::server']
instead fixes this.

Change-Id: I4ba7932d679764576a46ea599499991a5c57fc56
Closes-Bug: 1349316
(cherry picked from commit 5837aaeaadb14fdc089b25e666cfd8d91f0f53a6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/08/114308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require => Class['mysql::server'],

commit_message:
Disable Openstack services startup on install

Upstart makes services went off once installed.
We're wanting them started only then configured.
If ceph is used volumes, leave cinder-volume override
on its own (rbd.pp will configure it).

Closes-bug: #1348185
Closes-bug: #1335804

Change-Id: I50ff5b0f5bc3d80bfef917116a620bd9386e8e56
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/94/117194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ####### Disable upstart startup on install ####### if($::operatingsystem == 'Ubuntu') { tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'nova-api': package_name => 'nova-api', } tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'nova-compute': package_name => 'nova-compute', } tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'nova-network': package_name => 'nova-network', } # Ceph rbd backend configures its override on its own if !$::fuel_settings['storage']['volumes_ceph'] { tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'cinder-volume': package_name => 'cinder-volume', } } }

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2014-06-16 08:06:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/6ad51625a6b821a5c5e05a5420fcb716a20a74c7', 'message': "Adds REST API endpoint for action execution

Deployment is replaced with a more generic concept called 'action'.
Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.
Database table isn't renamed because in MySQL 5.5 this cannot be done without dropping FK constraints
in status table and this operation is not supported by SQLite. SQLite can rename table without errors but FK
constraint becomes invalid pointing to non-existing table. So renaming is done on Model level, not in DB

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions

Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.
Database table isn't renamed because in MySQL 5.5 this cannot be done without dropping FK constraints
in status table and this operation is not supported by SQLite. SQLite can rename table without errors but FK
constraint becomes invalid pointing to non-existing table. So renaming is done on Model level, not in DB

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions

commit_message:
Adds REST API endpoint for action execution

Deployment is replaced with a more generic concept called 'action'.
Action can be performed on any object of Object Model.
Actions are marked with 'Usage: Action' in MuranoPL code. They can have arguments.
List of available actions can be obtained from Object Model itself after initial deployment.
This commit adds ability to REST API invoke actions by providing its unique id (from OM) and parameters.
Also refactors API code to use tasks.

Change-Id: If21809340bb799af58a8d1a2d148e52565028970
Partially-Implements: blueprint application-actions
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/49/99449/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from murano.common import rpc from murano.db import models from murano.db.services import sessions class ActionServices(object): @staticmethod def execute(action_id, session, unit, token, args={}): environment = unit.query(models.Environment).get( session.environment_id) action = ActionServices.find_action(session.description, action_id) if action is None: raise LookupError('Action is not found') if not action[1].get('enabled', True): raise ValueError('Cannot execute disabled action') task = { 'action': { 'object_id': action[0], 'method': action[1]['name'], 'args': args }, 'model': session.description, 'token': token, 'tenant_id': environment.tenant_id } task['model']['Objects']['?']['id'] = environment.id task['model']['Objects']['applications'] = \ task['model']['Objects'].get('services', []) if 'services' in task['model']['Objects']: del task['model']['Objects']['services'] session.state = sessions.SessionState.deploying task_info = models.Task() task_info.environment_id = session.environment_id task_info.description = dict(session.description.get('Objects')) task_info.action = task['action'] status = models.Status() status.text = 'Action {0} is scheduled'.format(action[1]['name']) status.level = 'info' task_info.statuses.append(status) with unit.begin(): unit.add(session) unit.add(task_info) rpc.engine().handle_task(task) @staticmethod def find_action(model, action_id): if isinstance(model, list): for item in model: result = ActionServices.find_action(item, action_id) if result is not None: return result elif isinstance(model, dict): if '?' in model and 'id' in model['?'] and \ '_actions' in model['?'] and \ action_id in model['?']['_actions']: return model['?']['id'], model['?']['_actions'][action_id] for obj in model.values(): result = ActionServices.find_action(obj, action_id) if result is not None: return result else: return None

subject: [Hbase] Adds new functions redesigning keys for data storing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-19 12:59:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/c4d800974c3a7b0096efd438b945550ad6aac8fe', 'message': 'This patch is the part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/106376/15

Patch "Implement redesigned separator in names of columns in HBase" is
splitted because some new functions are needed by new patch
from Ilya Tyaptin in witch he implements migration in HBase storage.

If briefly patch with migration depends on this one and will be needed by
patch with implementation of new separator  in HBase columns
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/106376/15)

Related-bug: #1328114
Change-Id: I201fbe14e77ce2e7075b60f8fe353a3538d73db6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-20 12:17:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/5578beeefe3c0863855387a29b9f59d4785136a0', 'message': 'This patch is the part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/106376/15

Related-bug: #1328114
Change-Id: I201fbe14e77ce2e7075b60f8fe353a3538d73db6
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-20 18:59:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/507d13f3b465c9d042e6219adc3efdf413c12c86', 'message': '[Hbase] Adds new functions that is redesign keys for data storing in HBase

Function prepare_key constructs keys with column as separator.
Other methods "quote/unquote" deal with data that is used in keys construction.
Function "quote" exchanges all columns that it finds in getting params.
"unquote" restores getting data for its initial state.

Related-bug: #1328114
Change-Id: I201fbe14e77ce2e7075b60f8fe353a3538d73db6
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-21 04:31:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/92b42ca36099759b3be36a27bc4e0d29dca54978', 'message': '[Hbase] Adds new functions redesigning keys for data storing

Function prepare_key constructs keys with column as separator.
Other methods "quote/unquote" deal with data that is used in keys construction.
Function "quote" exchanges all columns that it finds in getting params.
"unquote" restores getting data for its initial state.
