subject: Support reserving ips at network create time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-23 20:38:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6b26784e4de7a3b6e12f8654cca9c9749eefc940', 'message': 'Support reserving ips at network create time

It is horribly inefficient to create a network and reserve a large
swath of ips, so allow the network creator to specify which ips
he wants to be available in the network by specifying allowed_start
and allowed_end.

Something like:

network-create foo --cidr 10.0.0.0/24 --allowed-start 10.0.0.5 \
    --allowed-end 10.0.0.250

would ensure that 10.0.0.0-10.0.0.4 and 10.0.0.254-10.0.0.255 are
marked reserved so instances would be assigned addresses from the
middle of the range.

Partially-implements blueprint better-support-for-multiple-networks

Change-Id: I5427e1a2d202658d374292559fc7054f2fa51124

commit_message:
Support reserving ips at network create time

It is horribly inefficient to create a network and reserve a large
swath of ips, so allow the network creator to specify which ips
he wants to be available in the network by specifying allowed_start
and allowed_end.

Something like:

network-create foo --cidr 10.0.0.0/24 --allowed-start 10.0.0.5 \
    --allowed-end 10.0.0.250

would ensure that 10.0.0.0-10.0.0.4 and 10.0.0.254-10.0.0.255 are
marked reserved so instances would be assigned addresses from the
middle of the range.

Partially-implements blueprint better-support-for-multiple-networks

Change-Id: I5427e1a2d202658d374292559fc7054f2fa51124

commit_message:
Updated documentation of "DummyProvider" to "ExistingServers"

ExistingServers replaced DummyProvider in code
a while ago, but documentation was not updated to reflect
the change until now.

commit_message:
ext-gw update on dvr router improperly handled by l3-agent

The recently added external_gateway method does not check
the agent mode or host binding before adding an external
gateway to a particular node/agent.  This fix adds the
required checks in the update path.

Change-Id: Idbb76eea1faec1c5d6b7615d23d74760cc327bb2
Closes-bug: #1356734

commit_message:
Fixes Neutron configuration

Fixes configuration for interface_driver. The driver configured was
nova.networklinux_net.LinuxOVSInterfaceDriver which is for flat
networks. In our labs cluster we are supporting L3 layer
functionality which is provided by
neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver.

Change-Id: I71d971a27afea377e27eb8acbb46d283a62b5aa3

commit_message:
Check for $[ in bash8

$[ is deprecated for the more familiar $((

Check for this in bash8 and fix the instances of it

Change-Id: I1cd72efd8d14db849060bcb2a353e78982183745

commit_message:
Expand baremetal nodes coverage `POST`

Expand `POST` tests for create baremetal nodes API:
    - expand post tests
    - added negative post tests
    - added parameters for Ironic's admin API which driver to use
      in config

Change-Id: I3172601a063a106a81103e6e55592727014f064c

commit_message:
Add sh as a requirement

sh module is an interface to use subprocess. It would allow us to
easily call any program as if it were a function

Our first use would be in solum, to use git in python code, instead
of having complicated subprocess call for each git command

sh is available on pypi here https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sh
documentations & examples http://amoffat.github.io/sh/

Change-Id: If8b34ed1ffa4cdd57ef3e60dfb964ae244436ddd

commit_message:
Garbage collect neutron ports not in nw_cache

This patch adds code which garbage collects ports in neutron that are
not found in nova's network cache and should be deleted. These ports
usually manifest when nova-compute fails to receive a response from neutron
when creating a port due to a timeout. This patch unfortunately needs to wrap
allocate_for_instance in @synchronized() in order to prevent a
possible race condition when hotplugging a network-interface to an instance
and the port is garbage collected before its put into the network_cache.

Closes-bug: #1324934

Change-Id: I1435b73756fe8f0702e2377a486e0a75ff0480bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/64769/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def lock_instance(name): """ Decorator used to create a lock for a particular instance and name. Requires self, context, and instance as function args """ def wrap(f): @functools.wraps(f) def inner(self, context, instance, *args, **kwargs): @lockutils.synchronized("%s-%s" % (name, instance['uuid'])) def _run_function_in_lock(): return f(self, context, instance, *args, **kwargs) return _run_function_in_lock() return inner return wrap
